entries: 泥沼尸体是在数个月内自然干尸化的人形尸体。这个过程使他们的皮肤变得坚韧而皮革般，保护他们免受伤害，并帮助他们在黑暗、危险的沼泽中保持隐形。在许多情况下，尸体的保存意味着乍一看，一个泥沼尸体很容易被误认为是一个活着的人，头发、皮肤甚至衣物仍然完好无损。
每当一个沼泽受到威胁时，一批新的泥沼尸体会浮现出来，加入到过去苏醒的尸体中。一个沼泽存在的时间越久，拥有的泥沼尸体就越多。一些最古老的沼泽拥有如此之多苏醒的泥沼尸体，以至于只有最强大的访客才能通过。
{@b {@i Silent Stalker.}} 泥沼尸体利用隐秘性袭击不留神的入侵者。它们擅长藏匿在显眼之处，与植物相融合或完全潜入混浊的水中，然后突然跃出，让目标措手不及。

entries.name: Marsh Hydra
entries: 湿地女巫、泥沼巫婆和其他湿地法师通常会避开陈词滥调的猫或鸟使，而选择更符合他们环境的东西：蛇。然而，对一些人来说，即使是一条经过魔法增强的蛇也太普通了。这些法师寻找古老的嫁接咒语，并利用它们创造沼泽九头蛇。这个巨大的怪物并不是真正的九头蛇，而是当一群蛇被魔法聚合成一个拥有多个蛇头的单一生物时形成的。
新创建的湿地水蛇{@b {@i Cooperation is Key.}几乎不可能被驯服，因为它们体内的个体蛇意识争夺主导权。许多湿地水蛇永远无法走出这个阶段，最终在内讧中丧生，最终证明过于混乱和暴力，无法成为有用的仆从。这种野生的湿地水蛇占了冒险者们遇到的大多数。然而，那些学会作为一个单一有机体共同工作的湿地水蛇可以胜任为其创造者服务。
{@b {@i Concealed Heads.}} 尽管它们像普通的九头蛇一样拥有多个头部，沼泽九头蛇的功能却有所不同。沼泽九头蛇的身体并非在头部被摧毁后重新生长，而是在外部最初看到的头部之外还包含更多头部。尽管沼泽九头蛇很少一次展示超过五到六个头部，有些个体体内却储存着多达二十四个额外的头部，这取决于它们最初创造者的野心。这些内部头部可以轮换，使得生物能够在一段时间内承受甚至最严重的伤势。

entries.name: Rot Angel
entries: 站立在五到六英尺高的位置，漂浮的黑褐色蘑菇在沼泽中如同水母般移动，它们的十三根可伸缩的眼柄垂挂在帽子下。这些腐朽天使实际上是天神，通常为死亡之神服务，寻找新近逝世的人。它们的触须状口器接触有机物会导致迅速腐烂。
{@b {@i Death's Cleanup Crew.}}死神会派遣腐朽天使来清除一个人灵魂被带走后尸体的所有痕迹。被腐朽天使接触后分解的尸体无法复活、变成不死生物，或者受到其他超自然影响。死神很少解释为什么某具尸体需要腐朽天使，而这些天使也不会询问。
{@b {@i Dedicated Servants.}} 一旦一位腐朽天使被派遣到一具尸体上，除了死亡，没有任何事情能阻止他们完成任务。如果一位腐朽天使在工作中被打断，他们有权利以任何必要的方式处理打断者，包括摧毁干扰力量。

entries.name: Swamp Dryad
entries: 沼泽树精会模仿它们所依附的树木。有些树精身形异常高大，扭曲的、细长的躯干很容易被误认为是树干。另一些则横向扩展，长着多达六只长臂，滴着苔藓。

{@b {@i Bound by Choice.}} 与它们更常见的表亲不同，沼泽树精开始它们的生命时通常是凡人，通常是草药师和其他沼泽居民，他们一生都在与家园融为一体。那些足够聪明、强大或幸运的人可能会遇到一位现有的沼泽树精，教给他们绑定的秘密。虽然这个过程是艰难的，可能会致命，但成功的绑定会将凡人转变为精灵，并将他们与所选择的树联系起来。一旦绑定，新的精灵和他们的树将与典型树精一样受到相同的限制。
{@b {@i Reclusive and Territorial.}} 在与湿地树精绑定后，他们与湿地植物和动物的新联系让他们对与人交往几乎没有兴趣。由于如果他们的树受到伤害将面临巨大危险，湿地树精对访客极为不信任。
{@b {@i Valuable Allies.}} 如果一个沼泽树精的信任被赢得，它们可以提供关于沼泽及其路径的知识，提供治疗和其他魔法的帮助，并提供建议，帮助避免或与其他沼泽居民互动。在这片陌生的地形中，一个沼泽树精盟友可能是生与死的分水岭。
{@creature Bog Body|FleeMortals}
{@creature Marsh Hydra|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Big Ball of Snakes
entries: 在沼泽乌贼出现之前，有一个大团蛇。当我们开始研究沼泽环境时，我们创造了一个生物，它只是一大团不同种类的蛇纠缠在一起形成的巨大球体，在沼泽中滚动寻找食物。这个属性块简单地被称为大团蛇。
我们对这个想法笑了很多，但最终决定大团蛇实在是太荒谬了，不适合这本书。设计团队仍然非常喜欢属性块的机制，所以我们改变了传说，调整了一些语言，于是，沼泽多头蛇诞生了。
{@creature Rot Angel|FleeMortals}
{@creature Swamp Dryad|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Underground
entries: 世界下方广阔的洞穴深处是危险和奇迹之地，充满了适应黑暗生活的奇怪居民。从爬行的捕食者到致命的真菌，威胁潜伏在阴影中，随时准备伏击不谨慎的冒险者。

entries.name: Underground Traits
entries: 您可以通过向现有生物的属性块中添加以下一个或多个特征来创建一个地下版本的生物：

items: {@optfeature Fungal Infestation|FleeMortals}
{@optfeature Shadow Blend|FleeMortals}
{@optfeature Underground Senses|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Underground Lair Actions
entries: {@legroup Underground|FleeMortals|Underground Lair Actions}
{@note Converter's Note: I thought about adding in the missing sentence here, but why bother? It's a copypasta from all of the other environmental lair action sections.}

entries.name: Deep Dreamer
entries: 一张精细的带刺黑色丝状网络支撑着深梦者的真菌体，使它们看起来像一个巨大而邪恶的蒲公英。这些植物在轻柔的灵能气流中飘荡，被它们不断释放的孢子推动着。当其他生物做梦时，深梦者利用它们的丝状结构来吸取这些生物的精神能量。深梦者的影响力可以迫使生物迷失在梦境中，永远无法醒来。
{@b {@i Drifting Dreams.}} 深梦者们似乎永远沉浸在自己的幻想中，与实体物体碰撞时常常毫无察觉。当他们意识到其他生物时，他们会利用自己的孢子分享奇异的梦境，希望激发生物的想象力，创造出美好的梦境以供滋养。
{@b {@i Sinister Bonds.}} 一些深梦者无意中积累了一群永远沉浸在梦境中的生物。这些生物会跟随他们的深梦者漂泊，迷迷糊糊地跟在真菌后面，甚至会跳到深梦者面前，拯救他们免受危险。有些生物已经和他们的梦者在一起很久了，以至于永远被系在梦者的一个丝线上。

entries.name: Gem Jelly
entries: 常见于洞穴中，自然晶体生长的地方，宝石果冻分泌消化酸，分解岩石并允许它们以产生的矿物质为食。它们的饮食赋予它们一种虹彩般的光泽，它们的身体经常反射出它们所吃晶体的颜色。
尽管这些软泥怪不以其他生物为食，(Gem Jellies)宝石果冻却极具领土意识，对入侵者毫不犹豫地发动攻击。
{@b {@i Crystal Mimicry.}} 宝石果冻在休眠状态下类似于天然的水晶形态，往往会让探险者觉得它很有价值。当这些闯入者靠近时，宝石果冻的真实本性很快就会显露出来，它们会用长长的水晶刺似的伪足进行攻击。
{@b {@i Psionic Organisms.}} 宝石果冻灵敏地与心灵能量相调和，可以发出脉冲，与其他生物的思维共鸣。这些脉冲可以用来传达简单的概念，比如"食物"或"危险"。有些人相信宝石果冻实际上是有智慧的，甚至有一些人出发寻找它们，寻求来自异世界的智慧......但大多数这些误入歧途的朝圣者从这段旅程中再也没有回来。
将第11层次元，即"地下世界"，转化为地下墓穴或坟墓，寻找残骸以供盛宴。"黑暗之下"，是一个洞穴和深邃的海洋的世界。那里没有天空，没有太阳。

entries.name: Leyleech
entries: 雷线虫居住在地下雷线附近的洞穴中。这些类似蛞蝓的生物以魔法为食；当它们感知到魔法的存在时，它们会伸出带着尖牙的口器，吸取能量并用其力量填饱自己。当一只雷线虫吃饱了，身体上的刺会充满魔法能量。
{@b {@i Frenzied Taste.}} 当灵脉寄生虫吸取自然灵脉能量时，它们会保持温顺和顺从。然而，活物施放的法术会让灵脉寄生虫陷入狂暴状态，导致它们饥饿地攻击，对自身安全毫无顾忌。
{@b {@i Dormant Threats.}} 当它们不在进食时，雷蛭会卷缩成类似岩石的茧，很容易被误认为是大石头，不留神的旅行者可能会发现自己与一个群体共享休息地。当它们感知到魔法的存在时，这些休眠的雷蛭会饥饿地苏醒过来。
当大量的(leyleeches)聚集在一个地区时，它们的进食可能会破坏甚至完全耗尽一条魔线，影响魔法在该区域的行为方式。当附近几个殖民地同时进食时，它可能影响数英里范围内的地区。

entries.name: Marvorok
entries: 马沃洛克斯（{@link marr-VORR-ock|https://mcdm.gg/FleeMortals/Marvorok.html}）是潜伏在地底深处的阴险捕食者，不断寻找猎物来满足他们似乎无尽的饥饿。这些怪物般的两足生物有六只手臂，其中四只末端长有锋利的剑状爪子。它们的视力很差，但通过不可思议的嗅觉弥补了这一点，使它们能够凭气味追踪猎物。马沃洛克斯使用它们的爪子挖进岩石表面并拉扯自己，像奔跑一样轻松地攀爬。
{@b {@i Silent Death.}} 马沃洛克 (marvoroks) 尽管体型庞大，却极其擅长隐秘行动，它们会潜伏等待猎物，然后在合适的时机发动攻击。它们耐心等待最佳的伏击时机，从隐藏处突然跳出，利用猎物脆弱的瞬间将其撕成碎片。
{@b {@i Solitary Hunters.}} 马沃洛克人更喜欢独居生活，只有在交配或狩猎特别大型或危险的猎物时才会聚集在一起。在食物短缺时，它们会合作将生物赶向一个共同的狩猎地点，以便将猎物困住。. . 尽管这通常会导致它们内部争斗，以确定谁能吃到。
{@b {@i Eaters of the Dead.}} 马沃洛克人并不介意寻找食物，他们会从长死生物的骨头上剥下腐烂的肉。挨饿的马沃洛克甚至会挠开地下墓穴或坟墓，寻找尸骸来享用。
{@creature Deep Dreamer|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Encountering a Deep Dreamer
entries: 深梦者遭遇通常有两种典型设置。第一种是深梦者身边有一群被真菌魅惑的生物，它们会为了保护深梦者而战斗。另一种是一个孤独的梦者漂浮在角色们上方的黑暗中，释放孢子试图在战斗开始之前将他们魅惑。
{@creature Gem Jelly|FleeMortals}
{@creature Leyleech|FleeMortals}
{@creature Marvorok|FleeMortals}
{@creature Gem Jelly Companion|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Mystic Connection: Gem Jelly
entries: 如果你在玩一个{@class beastheart|BST}并且有一个宝石果冻伙伴，当你在9级获得兽心的神秘联系特性时，你将获得以下好处：
钻石之肤 (Flesh to Diamonds). 作为一个奖励动作，你可以在自己的皮肤上覆盖一层硬化的水晶和宝石，持续10分钟。在此期间，你对钝击、穿刺和斩击伤害具有抗性。一旦你使用了这个奖励动作，你必须休息完成一次长休才能再次使用。
{@creature Leyleech Companion|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Mystic Connection: Leyleech
entries: 如果你在玩一个{@class beastheart|BST}并且有一个雷吸伴侣，当你在第9级获得兽心的神秘联系特性时，你将获得以下好处：
魔法削弱。作为一个奖励动作，你利用内在的魔法抵抗力。在1分钟内，你对所有由法术和魔法效果造成的伤害具有抗性。一旦你使用了这个奖励动作，直到你完成一次长休息之前，你不能再次这样做。

data.name: Chapter 3: Villain Parties
entries: 这一章按照在战斗中所呈现的威胁程度，介绍了七个恶棍团队（见{@book "Optimized Party Level"|FleeMortals|3|Optimized Party Level}）。在向游戏中引入这些恶棍时，请牢记以下指导。

entries.name: Portraying Villainy
entries: 这一部分中的所有派系都是明确的恶棍。这些角色不是中立的雇佣兵，不能通过谈判并有可能招募他们。他们是无情的人，想要做坏事——有时是非常可怕的事情。在许多情况下，他们做这些事情时还会感到愉悦。这些都是可怕的人。
我们相信，角色扮演游戏中的反派越是明确地邪恶，许多玩家就越有动力去与他们战斗——当他们的英雄取得胜利时，玩家们也会感到更加得意。但这只是一种口味问题，许多主持人和玩家对这种幻想并不感兴趣。他们可能更喜欢一个更具亲和力或滑稽的反派，或者他们可能更喜欢英雄们与自然对抗的冒险（尽管在这种情况下，这本书将没有什么用处）。我们也喜欢这些事情！

这本书中的生物都符合一定的现实主义和可信度，通过戏剧的镜头进行过滤。但即使是这本强大的巨著也很难与现实世界的邪恶相竞争，因为那种邪恶是如此的可怕和恐怖。有些玩家不希望他们的游戏变得如此竞争。了解你的游戏桌、与玩家交流，并了解他们喜欢和参与的戏剧类型是至关重要的。如果你阅读这些条目并发现某个反派的动机或方法对你的游戏桌来说太可怕了，你可以选择重新设计它们，保留它们的统计数据并改变它们的故事。我们建议使用安全工具，比如免费的MCDM桌面安全工具包中的工具，以便与玩家就任何让他们或你感到不舒服的事情进行清晰简洁的沟通。
这本书负责设计、测试和平衡这些反派的能力和特点。现在如何使用它们取决于你。如果你喜欢黑铁盟约的设定，但觉得他们的偏见令人不快，你可以把他们塑造成一个邪教的领袖，一个试图推翻一位受人爱戴领袖的秘密社团，或者任何对你的世界有意义的设定！
在一天结束时，这本书就是你的了。这些恶棍也是你的。你可以随心所欲地运用它们。

entries.name: Individual Villains
entries: 在本章中呈现的反派团队旨在与角色们一起战斗，但你也可以让英雄们在最终决战前分别对付反派。这些个别战斗仍应令人难忘，因此给你的反派一些手下、一个酷炫的消耗品魔法物品，以及一个逃跑（或复活）的合适手段。

entries.name: Optimized Party Level
entries: 每个恶棍小队都经过优化，以对抗特定等级的五名角色，如《（Villain Parties by Optimized Level）》表中所示。这些挑战是根据假设恶棍小队的所有成员一起参与战斗而计算的。它们旨在为优化等级的角色提供有趣的挑战，尤其是如果英雄们在另一场战斗中已经消耗了一些资源的情况下。
每个派对的反派都应该作为一个团队一起战斗。对于经过优化的等级的派对来说，他们是一个困难的遭遇，所以不要对你的角色投入太多的序幕遭遇。他们需要利用所有的法术位、强大的特性和其他资源来生存！

entries.name: Villain Party Actions
entries: 反派团队的行动方式与以行动为导向的生物的反派行动（见介绍中的{@book "Action-Oriented Creatures"|FleeMortals|0|Action-Oriented Creatures}）类似，但有以下变化：

items: 与其让一个生物拥有三个恶棍行动，一个队伍共享一个包含五个恶棍队伍行动的行动点池。
每个恶棍派对行动由恶棍派对中的特定生物执行，每个生物在敌人回合之后可以在一次遇敌中使用一次。
派对可以按任何顺序采取这些行动，但每轮只能有一个恶棍使用他们的行动。
只有在遇到中执行该动作的生物存在且不是{@condition incapacitated}时，才能执行恶棍动作。

entries: 每个派对的部分按照建议的顺序展示他们的反派行动，通常将最具破坏性的行动留到最后。很可能你不会在单次遭遇中使用每个反派行动，因为有些生物可能会在他们使用行动之前被击败。这没关系！如果每个反派行动都在一次遭遇中使用，那将会非常致命。

entries.name: Slow Burn
entries: 为了打造与（villain party）最激烈的对决，你应该在角色和他们的对手之间制造紧张气氛，直到最终爆发。让玩家渴望有机会击败这些邪恶的敌人。
首先，让角色们在与该团伙成员面对面之前，亲身了解恶棍的邪恶行径。例如，你可以让角色们在与恐怖分子见面之前，偶然发现了Wilderkith对一个和平社区的破坏后果。
那么你应该让角色与（the villain party）的手下互动。他们甚至可能与该派对的一两名成员交锋，或者从远处看到他们。给予角色充分的机会破坏该派对的一个或多个阴谋，并了解每个恶棍。他们获得的信息越多，挫败的计划越多，就越好！

最终，在角色们多次挫败计划后，反派团队应该反击。如果你在进行较短的游戏，这可能是最终对决的时刻，或者你可以让反派团队打击角色们的要害。就像角色们可能在调查反派一样，恶棍们也在调查英雄们。反派团队可能摧毁角色们重要的地点，伤害或绑架他们的NPC盟友，或者摧毁或偷走一件重要的个人物品。反派应该明确表示他们是干的，并留下一个明显的信息给角色们，比如说："如果你们不想看到更多你们所爱的东西遭受不幸，就赶紧退下吧。"
经过这一切，如果角色们还没有决定直接对抗恶棍，那么恶棍们会把战斗带到他们身边。他们设置陷阱，并在第一次机会时引爆它，豁出去摆脱那些给他们带来如此多痛苦的角色。

entries.name: Grave Order
entries: {@i Optimized for Five 3rd-Level Characters}

entries.name: Content Warning: Enslaved Spirit, Body Horror, and Religious Desecration
entries: 冒险者Elyas Leodeir的灵魂被囚禁在恐魔(Horror)的身体内，恐魔是由坟墓教派(Grave Order)操纵的不死战士。如果你不希望灵魂被囚禁和奴役在你的冒险中扮演角色，你可以将恐魔变成一个无意识的不死生物。此外，恐魔是由尸体组成的集合体；如果你的游戏中有人对这种程度的尸体恐怖感到不适，你可以将恐魔改为一个巨大的僵尸。
杰达·派克(Jedar Pike)的背景故事包括亵渎圣徒的遗骸。如果宗教亵渎是一个令你们团队感到不安的情节，那么杰达的亵渎仪式并不需要那些元素。
因其亵渎行为而备受唾弃，墓地秩序（Grave Order）的死灵术士和可怕的创造物试图通过亵渎死亡的自然秩序来掌控生者。如果让他们完善邪恶的仪式并收集尸体，他们肯定会以不死之灾降临在（Mundane World）平凡世界上。

entries.name: Background
entries: 墓地秩序（The Grave Order）除了他们自己的野心外，没有其他目标。每个成员因其独特的亵渎而受到排斥，但他们却逃脱了犯罪的后果。莱斯瑟里斯·索德雷（Lestheris Soldrei）将这个团体聚集在一起，以便他们可以用不死之力掌控世界。
尽管墓地秩序的盟友寥寥无几，他们会让那些缺失的力量复活——无论是强大的死灵构造体还是一群不死随从。

entries.name: Goals
entries: 尽管(`Grave Order`)中每位死灵术士都有独特的黑暗梦想，但他们共同致力于通过不死征服。因为他们被指责从事禁忌的追求而受到谴责，这个组织也对那些诋毁他们的人怀有积怨。所有阻碍(`Grave Order`)抱负的人将在即将到来的光荣的死者世界中遭受千倍的痛苦。
尽管这些死灵法师试图召唤一支军队，他们对普通人的空壳并不满意。(`The Grave Order`)挖掘伟大英雄的坟墓，并让他们的骨骼、血肉或灵魂复活。拥有传奇力量的(`The Grave Order`)将颠覆王国，让他们的宿敌心生畏惧。

entries.name: Methods
entries: 墓地秩序(The Grave Order)在世界各地游走，学习民间传说以追踪著名英雄的坟墓。他们在墓地和葬地附近扎营。在夜幕的掩护下，他们是无情的盗墓贼，把坟墓里的东西搜刮一空。他们对当地传统或信仰毫无尊重，将尸体当作达到真正目标的筹码。
如果被发现，坟墓秩序(`Grave Order`)对反对者毫不留情。干涉者只会增加更多尸体—如果这些尸体来自怀揣荣耀梦想和满腔热血的冒险者，那就更好了。

entries.name: Halorin Yandres
entries: {@creature Halorin Yandres|FleeMortals} 从年轻时就接受战斗训练。在证明了他对战争艺术的奉献后，这名人类被指派为年轻才华横溢的法师莱斯瑟里斯·索德雷的保镖。当她对哈洛林表现出善意和信任时，他也以同样的方式回报，与她分享了他最黑暗的秘密。
Halorin从一开始就支持他的被托付人的恐怖热情—部分是因为他对她的忠诚，但也受到他在生命在他手下消逝时所感受到的欣快感的驱使。这位战士享受以莱斯瑟瑞斯的名义杀戮，知道他的尸体有助于建立墓地秩序。
当一个被称为黄金勇气的冒险团试图让秩序得以伸张时，Halorin 勇敢地保护了 Lestheris 并在不幸中残忍地杀死了他们的敌人，最终不幸地死于他的伤口。这位死灵法师重新操纵了她的护卫的尸体，同时保留了他的意识。不死之身并没有减弱他的嗜血和忠诚。因为他的奉献精神，Halorin 在战斗中领导着秩序下的次等不死族。

entries.name: Jedar Pike
entries: 一个人类背教者牧师，{@creature Jedar Pike|FleeMortals} 侍奉一个名为沃多尔（Vodor）的存在，声称自己是被困忘却的死亡之神。沃多尔承诺给予杰达（Jedar）无法想象的力量，作为解放的交换条件。为了解放他的主人，杰达亵渎了被埋葬的圣徒的骨骸进行了亵渎的仪式，但在完成咒语之前被抓住。他即将被处决时，莱斯瑟里斯（Lestheris）和哈洛林（Halorin）闯入，击败了卫兵和刽子手，招募杰达加入了墓穴教团（Grave Order）。
杰达(Jedar)冷酷无情的态度掩盖了他对沃多(Vodor)的狂热信仰。他擅长操纵骨骼的魔法，并利用实体不死生物来保护和支持他的盟友。
死者比活人更容易控制。死亡会让你看清事物的真相。不要抗拒它的拥抱。

entries.name: Lestheris Soldrei
entries: {@creature Lestheris Soldrei|FleeMortals}在年轻时被视为巫师奇才，在得到保护和机会的照顾下蓬勃发展。这位半精灵长大后成为一个贪婪的奥术学者，导师们认为她对死灵魔法的学术兴趣只是一种病态的好奇，但她的兴趣很快变成了对禁忌的实验。莱斯瑟丽斯梦想着欺骗死亡，永远统治——她相信宇宙应该因为她的才华而奖赏她——而她忠诚的侍卫哈洛林只是鼓励了她的野心。
莱斯瑟里斯的老师们终于看到了她身上的邪恶，禁止她继续与死灵术纠缠。但这位年轻法师已经尝到了力量的滋味，她杀死了无知的老师们，并夺走了他们的魔法书。
决心成为一名巫妖并永远统治(`Mundane World`)，莱斯瑟里斯(`Lestheris`)创建了(`Grave Order`)，聚集其他(`necromancers`)一起努力实现她宏伟的愿景。虽然她在(`necromancy`)的各个方面都很娴熟，但莱斯瑟里斯专攻(`incorporeal`)：驭服灵魂，捆绑灵魂，并用这些本质强化她的魔法。

entries.name: Mycete
entries: 一位神秘的提弗林，带着一种心不在焉的气息，{@creature Mycete|FleeMortals}的身体布满了美丽寄生真菌的黄色血管。她与真菌建立了共生关系，对它倾注了深深的喜爱，并将其命名为琥珀腐朽(Amber Decay)。Mycete梦想着培育一座覆盖整个世界的花园——这个梦想很快就让她与家乡村庄的人们产生了分歧，因为这种真菌在人形生物的垂死身体中生长得最好......如果这些身体后来被复活，真菌将继续在它们的不死之躯中茁壮成长。
在Mycete被抓到屠杀邻居，用他们作为她的花朵的僵尸宿主后，村民们抓住了这位死灵法师，计划将她和她的创造物烧死。墓地秩序干预了，杀死了村民，救下了Mycete，并将她带入了他们的阵营。她擅长在不死生物的腔体中培育琥珀腐朽，并将其传播到战场上，阻碍和削弱她的敌人。

entries.name: The Horror
entries: {@creature The Horror|FleeMortals}是一个由缝合的皮肤和移植的肢体构成的膨胀构造，携带着由磨尖的骨头制成的武器。墓地秩序将这个创造物从黄金勇气的尸体中缝合而成，黄金勇气是一个敢于挑战死灵法师的冒险队伍。然后，他们将埃莱亚斯·利奥迪尔的灵魂——一个狡诈的盗贼，杀死了哈洛林并招致莱斯瑟里斯的私人怒火——绑定到这个怪诞的形态上。
被莱斯瑟利斯(Lestheris)的魔法所迷惑，埃利亚斯(Elyas)被迫在由他以前的朋友们构成的监狱中不情愿地战斗。这个不可动摇的死亡和毁灭化身是墓地秩序(Grave Order)中最伟大的不死生物创造物，也是死灵术士未来军队的第一个预兆。

entries.name: Magic
entries: Halorin戴着{@item pendant of grave regeneration|FleeMortals}，这是Lestheris在他复活后送给他的礼物。Lestheris携带着{@item Tome of the Ethereal|FleeMortals}。

entries.name: Grave Order Villain Actions
entries: 墓地秩序有五个恶棍团队行动。在敌人的回合之后，团队可以在一次遭遇中每个行动各执行一次。团队可以以任何顺序执行这些行动，但每轮只能执行一个。只有在执行该行动的生物在场并且不是{@condition incapacitated}时，才能执行该行动。

items.name: Action 1: Bulwark of Bone
entries: 杰达(Jedar)操控四个{@creature decrepit skeleton|FleeMortals}，它们出现在他能看到的距离30英尺内的空地上。这些骷髅会在与杰达相同的先攻值后立即行动，并听从他的口头命令。如果杰达死亡，这些骷髅也会被摧毁。

items.name: Action 2: Forward Assault
entries: Halorin命令他周围30英尺内能听到他的每个友方不死随从。每个目标可以移动其速度，而不会引发机会攻击。

items.name: Action 3: Threshing Flail
entries: 恐惧生物以其速度移动，而不会引发机会攻击。当恐惧生物结束移动时，他们会将骨钩挥舞在身边，每个在30英尺范围内的敌人必须进行一次{@dc 14} 敏捷豁免。未通过豁免的生物将受到7({@damage 2d6})点穿刺伤害并被击倒{@condition prone}。通过豁免的生物将受到一半伤害且不会被击倒{@condition prone}。

items.name: Action 4: Fungal Paradise
entries: Mycete选择她控制范围内并且距离她30英尺以内的一个或多个{@creature rotting zombie|FleeMortals}。每个被选择的僵尸被摧毁并在一个半径为10英尺的球体内爆炸。每个爆炸区域内的生物必须进行一次{@dc 13}宪法豁免才能，未通过则受到5({@damage 2d4})点死灵伤害，通过则减半。每个爆炸区域的地面都会被真菌生长覆盖，就像受到Mycete的真菌生长行动的影响一样。如果Mycete在30英尺内没有控制的腐烂僵尸，则她会使用她的操控躯壳，即使它不可用，也不会消耗使用次数。

items.name: Action 5: The Tide of Death
entries: 莱斯瑟瑞斯(Lestheris)会激活与她能看见的敌人数量相等的{@creature shade|FleeMortals}个阴影。每个阴影出现在她能看见的未被占据的空间内，距离她不超过30英尺。这些阴影会在与莱斯瑟瑞斯相同的先攻顺序中立即行动，并遵循她的口头指令。如果莱斯瑟瑞斯死亡，这些阴影也会被摧毁。
我为莱斯瑟献出了生命。她将它还给了我，还多了一点。你的尸体将属于我来指挥。

entries.name: Golden Valor
entries: 当黄金之勇者们敢于面对墓地秩序时，他们倒下了。现在，他们的尸体构成了恐怖。这群冒险者以猎杀强盗和小恶魔教派而闻名，当他们决定挑战墓地秩序时。他们的成员包括以下英雄：

items: 艾莱斯·莱德尔（Elyas Leodeir）, 一名半精灵盗贼
加尔·尾钩(Gar Tailhooks)，一名矮人蛮族战士(dwarf barbarian)。
奥利安德拉·芬威克，一名人类游侠
Scrubias Nackvar，一位侏儒（gnome）巫师（wizard）
威利斯·托马克(Wilis Tormack)，一名人类圣骑士。

entries: {@creature Halorin Yandres|FleeMortals}
{@creature Jedar Pike|FleeMortals}
{@creature Lestheris Soldrei|FleeMortals}
{@creature Mycete|FleeMortals}
{@creature The Horror|FleeMortals}
黄色是一种如此美丽的颜色，你不觉得吗？有许多美好的、赋予生命的事物都是那种充满活力的色调——花粉、太阳，还有我的琥珀腐蚀(Amber Decay)。世界穿上黄色看起来更美好。

entries.name: Abominations
entries: {@i Optimized for Five 5th-Level Characters}

entries.name: Content Warning: Body Horror, Torture, Cannibalism, and Eugenics
entries: 畏惧兽人（The Abominations）喜欢屠杀、折磨和吞食人类，每个畏惧兽人的身体都是由各种人类和动物部位拼凑而成的。如果这会让你的团队感到不愉快，你可以让畏惧兽人看起来更自然（或者更神奇），而不是丑陋的。同样，你可以跳过它们屠杀尸体、吃人和其他暴力和血腥细节的描述。
畏惧兽 (`The Abominations`) 的起源故事涉及对有智慧生物进行无数轮实验，然后谋杀任何被认为"不完美"的创造物。如果这对你游戏中的任何人造成伤害，你可以决定 N'shalla 和 Evae 早期的创造物无法活得很长时间（如果有的话），或者干脆跳过实验性批次。
你以为你已经甩掉了它们。天黑下来，雨越下越大，当你逃跑时，它们还在口中塞满了精灵肉块。但就在你喘息间，你的大脑爆炸般的疼痛，让你跪倒在地。那些动物头的掠食者们聚集在你周围，舔着嘴唇，咯咯地笑着，带着饥渴的喜悦。那些憎恶者已经吃掉了其他所有人。现在他们要吃掉你。

entries.name: Background
entries: 也许是某个邪恶的神明将那些造物的创造者们聚集在一起。也许这只是命运的残酷戏弄。在他们各自的组织因为对不愿意的实验而将他们流放之后，德鲁伊恩沙拉(N'shalla)和法师伊维·雅恩(Evae Yawn)相遇了——并立刻坠入了爱河。他们将激情和禁忌知识结合在一起，这对扭曲的伴侣开始了他们黑暗的工作。

决心创造出嗜血的怪物，以报复恋人们的旧组织，恩沙拉(N'shalla)和伊维(Evae)不断制造怪物，摧毁他们认为不完美的任何一个。伊维每次开始创造时，都会从原材料中培育出一个无生命的人形外壳，然后恩沙拉用野生动物的部分替换其头部和四肢。然后，他们一起赋予这些怪物生命......当这些生物不可避免地显示出缺陷时，邪恶的恋人们就会结束它们，并重新开始。经过十年的失败，伊维和恩沙拉终于相信他们取得了胜利——他们创造了一群五个生物，看起来是力量、美丽、凶猛和冷酷智慧的终极结合。但这些怪物并不听话。它们饥渴无比。
在被撕裂之前，恩沙拉(N'shalla)的最后一句话是："你们不是我们的孩子。你们是可憎的存在！"在吞食了两位创造者之后，他们的孩子们依然饥饿。他们开始狩猎。

entries.name: Goals
entries: 畏惧者们有一个目标——吞食强大人形生物的肉体、器官和骨骼。他们狂热地相信这会让他们在身体和精神上变得更强大。这些着迷的捕食者没有其他爱好或兴趣。他们只有下一次猎物。

entries.name: Methods
entries: 这些怪物在人类定居点外面扎营，观察人口数天后才选择最值得食用的目标。冒险者是最美味的肉，因为他们拥有强大的力量——而且很少有普通人会调查那些过着危险生活的英雄的死因。憎恶者们特别喜欢那些练习奥术或自然魔法的人，因为这让他们想起了他们的第一餐。这样的猎物会被慢慢而又仪式化地献祭，一节一节地被拆解和吞食。
通常，恶棍们会耐心等待猎物离开城镇或村庄，然后再发动袭击，但如果目标特别诱人，他们愿意冒险在夜间潜入定居点。他们绑架猎物，然后在一个安全地点一起享用晚餐，而不是当场吃掉受害者，他们也从不在同一个猎场逗留太久。在从一个城市到另一个城市的旅途中，他们会吃掉被拦截的旅行者和误入歧途的农民，尽管这远非他们的首选食物。

entries.name: Boog
entries: 身高超过十英尺，拥有强壮体格的{@creature Boog|FleeMortals}喜欢屠杀和破坏。他们长着犀牛的头、大象的腿和大猩猩的胳膊。Boog并不擅长常识，他们的方法缺乏微妙之处，但在战斗中无疑非常有效：Boog冲向前方，击倒或制服目标，然后转移到下一个目标。
布格(Boog)只说以"布格(Boog)"开头的两个字短语：布格(Boog)砸。布格(Boog)杀。布格(Boog)吞。由于他们体型庞大且缺乏细微之处，布格(Boog)在侦察任务中仍与西玛尔(Ceemal)留在营地。在这些时候，西玛尔(Ceemal)宠爱布格(Boog)，这只大怪物已经开始像孩子对待父母一样对待西玛尔(Ceemal)。

entries.name: Ceemal
entries: {@creature Ceemal|FleeMortals}担任着团队的心灵导师和屠夫。他们有着骆驼的头部和驼峰，以及斑纹腿和斑马的后蹄。尽管他们的前肢展示着骆驼的分蹄蹄，但这些蹄能像人类的手一样灵活运动。多亏了充满章鱼血液的血管，当危险临近时，Ceemal可以轻松地融入周围环境。
Ceemal不和其他畸变体一起去狩猎，更喜欢留在营地准备解剖捕获的猎物。当畸变体们在一起时，Ceemal像一个关心的父母一样照顾其他人，保持和平，照顾他们的朋友，为他们端上食物。Boog在Ceemal的心中有着特别的地位。
由于它们闪闪发光的大眼睛和无威胁的草食动物身体部位，很容易误以为(Ceemal)是一种善良无辜的生物——但当受害者向它们乞求宽恕时，(Ceemal)唯一的回应是用一把锋利的刀精准地切开颈动脉。

entries.name: Excess
entries: 一个巨大的混合体，拥有一个巨大的毒蛇头部，蝎子尾巴和四条巨大的蜘蛛腿，{@creature Excess|FleeMortals}的外表让大多数遇到它们的人感到恐惧。但真正的恐怖开始于Excess将它们的头部和躯干放大，以吞下一个人形生物。

在当地语言习惯的基础上，文本中类似 (%num%) 的内容在翻译时仍应保持为 (%num%)。

最狡诈的憎恶生物之一，过剩 (Excess) 能够挤进狭窄的空间，不需任何装备就能攀爬陡峭的墙壁和天花板。它们在下水道、洞穴和其他潮湿黑暗的地方为团队侦察。
虽然他们喜欢与家人一起狩猎，(Excess) 是这群中最独立的。他们有时会寻找自己的食物，享受独自潜行追捕的挑战。

entries.name: Klar
entries: 在Ceemal照顾邪兽的舒适度时，{@creature Klar|FleeMortals}领导狩猎。Klar拥有一头高贵的狮子头，伪装成英勇的天界存在，用甜言蜜语引诱受害者，然后用锋利的螳螂爪将其劈成两半。他们在战场上用袋鼠般的腿蹦跳，袭击敌人然后撤退。
Klar拥有鲸鱼的萎缩肺，鱼的鳃，和鸟类的鸣管。他们可以制造各种独特的声音和噪音来分散或吓唬敌人。
最近，卡拉（Klar）对许多受害者在临死前对祈祷的痴迷产生了兴趣。他甚至怀疑邪兽（Abominations）可能是某位神圣创造者计划的一部分，因此他甚至推迟了对俘虏们的贪婪，以讨论神圣和创世。然而，没有一个受害者能够永远逃脱卡拉的口中。

entries.name: Sair
entries: 被幸存的稀有者称为飞行心灵尖啸者，{@creature Sair|FleeMortals}拥有龙的翅膀和尾巴，恐龙的脚，以及猫头鹰的头部。它们从天空中侦察猎物，并寻找新的狩猎地点。
Sair的创造者在飞行畸变体中赋予了超能力。Sair利用这些天赋来迷惑猎物，将它们赶入等待中的兄弟姐妹的爪子中。
在邪物中，赛尔(Sair)尤为残忍，经常被西玛尔(Ceemal)责骂玩弄食物。这只有翅膀的邪物喜欢在死亡前嘲弄猎物，有时会把受害者带到天空，威胁要将他们扔下去。

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: 布格携带着从一名被杀死的巫师那里夺取的一颗魔法球，被憎恶者称为{@item Boog's ball|FleeMortals}。在营地，西玛尔总是保持着从恩沙拉的花园中采集的{@item poison popper|FleeMortals}。
{@item Boog's Ball|FleeMortals}
{@item Poison Popper|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Abominations Villain Actions
entries: 可怕生物(Abominations)有五个恶棍派对动作。在敌人回合结束后，派对可以在遭遇中每个动作各执行一次。派对可以以任何顺序执行这些动作，但每轮只能执行一个。只有在执行动作的生物在场且不是{@condition incapacitated}时，才能执行该动作。

items.name: Action 1: Aerial Transport
entries: Sair可以移动两倍的速度。在此移动之前或期间，他们可以携带并运送一个愿意的大型畸变生物，或者最多两个愿意的中型或更小的畸变生物，这些生物必须在距离Sair 5英尺的范围内。Sair可以在移动过程中的任何时候释放携带的畸变生物，并必须在移动结束时释放所有携带的畸变生物。如果一个畸变生物在离地面10英尺或更高的地方被释放，它们会坠落并着陆{@condition prone}，受到每10英尺坠落的正常3({@damage 1d6})点钝击伤害。

items.name: Action 2: Hypnotize
entries: Excess（Excess）的眼睛变成白色，从一边摇摆到另一边。从Excess（Excess）身上辐射出的一个15英尺锥形范围内的每个生物必须成功通过一次DC 13的感知豁免才能抵抗Excess（Excess）的魅惑，直到Excess（Excess）的下一个回合开始。在这种方式下被魅惑的生物，速度为0。

items.name: Action 3: All You Can Meat
entries: Ceemal打开腰包，向他们周围30英尺内能看到的每个畸变体扔一块肉。每个未失去行动能力的目标可以食用这块肉，恢复8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) 点生命值（无需行动）。

items.name: Action 4: Come and Get It
entries: Klar 以不引发机会攻击的方式移动其速度，并进行最多两次螳螂爪攻击。然后，每个可以听到 Klar 的、距离 Klar 30英尺内的畸变体可以以不引发机会攻击的方式移动其速度朝向 Klar。

items.name: Action 5: Boog Stomp
entries: 布格愤怒地跺脚在地上。在布格周围30英尺范围内的每个敌人必须进行一次DC 15的敏捷豁免检定，失败的话会受到14({@damage 4d6})点的钝击伤害，并且倒地{@condition prone}，成功的话只受到一半伤害且不会倒地。

entries.name: Abominations in Disguise
entries: 即使是最潜行的畸变体也很难在城市中找到下一顿饭或悄悄接近角色们在客栈中逗留时。如果你希望畸变体进入定居点而不引起警报，考虑让它们获得幻术或变形魔法、一件魔法物品，比如一个{@item hat of disguise}，或其他功能，可以让它们在人群中自由行走，包括角色们，在不被注意到的情况下。
{@creature Boog|FleeMortals}
布格狩猎。布格追逐。布格粉碎！布格吃. . . 布格饥饿。
{@creature Ceemal|FleeMortals}
你好，旅行者。在火堆旁坐下吧。我的朋友们随时就会回来，然后就是晚餐时间了。请你加入我们吧？我相信你一定很想知道我是谁。
{@creature Excess|FleeMortals}
{@creature Klar|FleeMortals}
{@creature Sair|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Sair's Got Range
entries: Sair（赛尔）的飞行速度与其超能力箭攻击的射程达到120英尺，这意味着他们永远不需要与角色进行近战。虽然大多数团队至少有几个角色拥有远程法术和武器，但有些团队可能会发现，如果Sair只是从无法接触的位置进行攻击，这可能会让他们感到沮丧。如果你正在对抗一个主要专注于近战和短程攻击的团队，给他们一些战斗机会，让Sair保持在地面附近。

entries.name: Black Iron Pact
entries: {@i Optimized for Five 7th-Level Characters}

entries.name: Content Warning: Body Horror, Torture, Cannibalism, and Eugenics
entries: 黑铁盟（Black Iron Pact）拥抱一种特别恶劣的意识形态，以种族主义和性别歧视为中心。由于这种邪恶存在于现实世界中，扮演黑铁盟可能会让游戏对一些玩家来说不安全且不好玩。在运行黑铁盟之前，与您的团队讨论这些话题，以了解他们对扮演这样的反派是否热情。一些玩家可能渴望打倒这些偏执者，而对于其他人来说，这种不公可能触及现实太深。您可以随时改变黑铁盟的动机，也许让他们成为想要为一个专制的神明占领世界上最伟大城市的异教徒。这对大多数英雄来说已经是一个邪恶的议程，可以采取行动了！
种族主义狂热分子错误地相信人类的优越性，黑铁盟约秘密密谋推翻首都的多元传统——由其世界主义的居民宣称为"这个或任何时代最伟大的城市"。黑铁盟约计划在这些传统的地方建立一个由不可战胜的阿贾克斯（Ajax the Invincible）铁圣统治的严厉神权统治。

entries.name: Background
entries: 一个秘密社团，旨在推翻首都的政治和文化结构，黑铁盟约的名字取自阿贾克斯(Ajax)的绰号，铁圣者。铁是对这位暴君圣者具有深刻象征意义的金属。
誓约的五名最强大成员——高级指挥部——正式领导着这个社团，并担任其突击团队。黑铁誓约的原始创始人的身份和下落是严格保密的秘密，只有Ajax和高级指挥部知道。
誓约的真实人数也仍然是一个谜，许多市民在不知情的情况下为他们工作。这种诡计确保了誓约的特工们不会被追溯到高级指挥部。

entries.name: Goals
entries: 黑铁盟约的主要目标是征服首都，并将阿贾克斯安插为其统治者和神。盟约的特工是阿贾克斯福音的忠实信徒，他们寻求通过武力和暴力来实现改变。他们邪恶的信仰是人类是这个世界的真正所有者，因此只有人类才能加入黑铁盟约，尽管在被捕或死亡风险较高时，该社会会利用非人类棋子。此外，盟约的许多成员，尤其是资深成员厄拉斯姆斯和他的妻子阿瓦拉，公开嘲笑行会的概念（基本上蔑视中产阶级的每个人），并反对除人类男性以外的任何人担任公职、拥有任何资产，甚至学习阅读。
为了实现阿贾克斯(Ajax)的征服，这个盟约寻找着林威尔(Ringwell)的位置，这是一个失落已久的古代库藏，里面存放着来自一个倒塌帝国的强大而危险的物品。他们打算掠夺这个宝库，并将最伟大的神器交给阿贾克斯。

entries.name: Methods
entries: 高级指挥部维护着一个名为囊肿（Cyst）的私人半位面，这是一个仅有几英里大小的小世界，高级成员可以通过名为{@item iron ring|FleeMortals}的魔法物品进入（详见后文"魔法物品"）。囊肿既是一个据点，也是契约团的战斗任务的集结地，尽管大多数普通成员并不知道它的存在。
高级指挥部的领导者作为一个团队对待他们的敌人，给任何冲突带来压倒性的力量。他们不允许任何可能会报告他们存在的幸存者，因为高级指挥部包括贵族和行会领袖，他们在这个邪教中的成员身份必须保密。
黑铁盟只有在经过细致研究和深思熟虑后才实施他们的计划。当高级指挥成员袭击一个目标时，他们会让敌人措手不及，确保取得胜利。如果事情出现意外，他们可以使用一个{@item iron ring|FleeMortals}撤退。

entries.name: Lord Erasmus Deseo
entries: 在黑铁盟高级指挥部中的第一人，{@creature Lord Erasmus Deseo|FleeMortals}是第十三代伯爵德塞奥，一个在首都最古老的贵族家族纳瓦尔家族庇护下的小贵族家族。他代表了一小部分具有种族主义和性别歧视观念的首都贵族。

除了神秘的契约创始人外，埃拉斯莫斯是最资深的成员。他喜欢团结友爱，并已将自己团结在志同道合的人身边。在他看来，契约的邪恶理念很受欢迎。即使在有礼貌的场合，他也会公开发表他的偏执观点。虽然房间里通常会分成那些公开赞同和那些保持沉默的人，但他确信即使后者也同意他——因为谁会反对对他来说如此明显的"事实"呢？在他扭曲邪恶的思想中，那些公开谈论平等正义和自由的人只是在迎合潮流；私下里，所有明智的人肯定都知道这是一个男人的时代。埃拉斯莫斯如此迷恋自己错误的理念，以至于他没有注意到大多数人几乎都在掩饰对他的厌恶——有些人是出于礼貌，有些人是出于对主人权力的恐惧。

entries.name: Canon Athenodorus
entries: 在青少年时期搬到首都后，{@creature Canon Athenodorus|FleeMortals} 无合金者加入了圣志士佩拉里奥教堂，最终晋升为中级教堂官员。虽然他公开宣扬圣志士佩拉里奥的教义，这位雄心壮志的守护圣徒，但他私下里却努力说服同僚加入阿贾克斯教堂。据他所说，几位黑手骑士——一个由圣志士佩拉里奥教堂赞助的团体——对阿贾克斯的暴虐教义表示同情。
黑手套骑士团被认为是首都中最伟大的骑士团。如果阿西诺多鲁斯确实能将他们转变为黑铁盟约的盟友，阿贾克斯对首都的征服几乎可以说是必然的。

entries.name: Cloak
entries: 高级指挥部的刺客大师，{@creature Cloak|FleeMortals}的身份是一个严密保守的秘密。她接近了厄拉斯姆斯·德塞奥领主，并在发现了高级指挥部的身份并未持有{@item iron ring|FleeMortals}的情况下，进入了囊肿。这一大胆举动如此打动了黑铁盟约的领袖，以至于他接受了她的提议和匿名条件。
斗篷(Cloak)与厄拉斯莫斯领主(Lord Erasmus)一起策划黑铁盟约(Black Iron Pact)的行动。通常是斗篷(Cloak)负责搜集情报、行贿，确保在高级指挥部(High Command)发动行动时没有任何意外或隐藏的变数。他们的胜利很大程度上归功于她无懈可击的准备工作。高级指挥部的成员们猜测，斗篷(Cloak)是城市中一家主要行会的高级排名且关系广泛的成员。

entries.name: Lady Avalla Deseo
entries: Lady Avalla Deseo（阿瓦拉·德塞奥）, Lord Erasmus（埃拉斯莫斯勋爵）的妻子，帮助塑造了黑铁盟约（Black Iron Pact）的邪恶言论，尤其是涉及女性问题。她对性别的这些落后理念充满激情地传道，并在家中和Cyst（囊肿）中听从丈夫的意见。
Avalla在帝国魔法学院也是一位高级巫师，拥有丰富的知识和权威，并不矛盾于她（或她的丈夫）。许多同事不尊重她的观点，但她的权力无法否认。学生很快就会发现，那些大胆质疑Avalla邪恶理念的人会因编造的理由被踢出学院。
经过艰苦的努力和实验，阿瓦拉（Avalla）已经修改了她的{@item iron ring|FleeMortals}，使其更加有用。她可以在危急时刻迅速激活它，并用它来传送佩戴戒指的契约成员。

entries.name: Qar, Master of Jackals
entries: {@creature Qar, Master of Jackals|FleeMortals|Qar}登上了里奥哈的卡拉维尔号，当它停靠在克姆内费尔港的港口时。他在那里服务多年，作为一名战士和水手，直到他和船员们在{@i Ainsurabaloc}上与强大的巫师激战。卡尔发现自己孤身一人，手无寸铁，面对着一位来自希加拉的僧侣，身上布满了恶魔豺狼的纹身。在一次幸运的机会中，卡尔打败了这位僧侣，不知不觉地吸收了她的力量、头衔和技巧。现在卡尔是豺狼大师。
当{@i Priceless Pearl}下次停靠首都时，他离开了{@i Priceless Pearl}的服务，加入了区域守卫队。凭借他不正当获得的能力，他晋升为队长。在一次特别残酷的街头遭遇之后，Qar在报纸上被引述说："城市的气味和肮脏让人难以忍受。" 这引起了黑铁盟的注意，德塞奥领主亲自招募他加入高级指挥部。
卡尔（Qar）特别喜欢施加不必要的残忍，在战场上，他利用自己的机动性在盟友能够治愈他们之前杀死昏迷的敌人。

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: 黑铁盟约的高级指挥成员都佩戴着{@item iron ring|FleeMortals}。阿瑟诺多洛斯手持着{@item star of iron|FleeMortals}。
{@item Iron Ring|FleeMortals}
{@item Star of Iron|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Black Iron Pact Villain Actions
entries: 黑铁盟约有五种恶棍派对行动。在敌人的回合之后，派对可以在遭遇中每种行动各执行一次。派对可以以任何顺序执行这些行动，但每轮只能使用一种。只有在执行该行动的生物在场且不是{@condition incapacitated}时，才能执行该行动。

items.name: Action 1: Party Tactics
entries: Qar和每个在60英尺内且能看到或听到他的盟友都可以移动他们的速度。

items.name: Action 2: Curse of Iron
entries: 阿西诺多罗斯释放了一道魔法咒语。他能看到的每个敌人在他30英尺内必须进行一次DC 15的感知豁免检定。未通过检定的目标会受到14({@damage 4d6})点死灵伤害，并且在1分钟内被{@condition blinded}（豁免在回合结束时结束）。通过检定的目标会受到一半伤害且不会被致盲。

items.name: Action 3: Promised Storm
entries: 阿瓦拉向她能看到的距离不超过90英尺的生物发射一道闪电。然后，闪电会从那个目标跳到她选择的最多两个其他生物身上，这些生物距离第一个目标不超过30英尺。每个目标必须进行一次15格敏捷豁免，未通过豁免则受到22({@damage 4d10})点闪电伤害，通过则只受到一半伤害。

items.name: Action 4: Assassin's Strike
entries: 披风移动自己的速度，然后对自己能够触及的生物进行一次短剑攻击。命中时，该攻击造成33({@damage 6d10})穿刺伤害，而不造成{@condition poisoned}状态。未命中时，该攻击造成一半伤害。

items.name: Action 5: Playtime's Over
entries: 厄拉斯穆斯对距离他60英尺以内且能听到他的高级指挥成员下达命令。目标可以使用他们的恶棍派对行动，即使他们在这次遭遇中已经使用过。

items.name: Retreat to the Cyst
entries: 黑铁盟约高级指挥部的每个成员都可以利用他们的{@item Iron Ring|FleeMortals}行动来传送离开一场失败的战斗。当角色将一个或多个恶棍逼入绝境并需要迅速撤离时，你可以利用这个行动。这一举动将让角色意识到黑铁盟约成员如何可以传送脱离危险，给角色准备下一次遭遇的对策的机会。在一起战斗时，高级指挥部的成员通常不会撤退，直到至少有一个人倒下。

items: {@creature Lord Erasmus Deseo|FleeMortals}
{@creature Canon Athenodorus|FleeMortals}
{@creature Cloak|FleeMortals}

items.name: Who is Cloak?
entries: 我们特意保留了{@creature Cloak|FleeMortals}的身份之谜，这样你就可以更好地将黑铁盟约融入你的战役故事中。她可能是一个与角色关系密切的NPC，自他们抵达首都以来一直在暗中监视他们。她可能是一个秘密英雄，正在内部努力打倒黑铁盟约。她可能是一个富有的贵族或政治家，不信任任何人，甚至不信任Erasmus，以保持她参与这个邪恶组织的秘密。

items: {@creature Lady Avalla Deseo|FleeMortals}
{@creature Qar, Master of Jackals|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Wilderkith
entries: {@i Optimized for Five 9th-Level Characters}

entries.name: Content Warning: Terrorism
entries: 野蛮精灵(Wilderkith)是邪恶的恶棍，他们利用恐惧来推动他们的议程。他们不仅摧毁由扩张性文明建造的结构，而且会肆意杀戮，迫使人们逃离城市。如果您或您的玩家不喜欢玩恐怖主题的游戏，您可以让野蛮精灵更加策略和精确地计划他们的袭击。让他们等到建筑物空无一人再拆毁，只杀死那些推动扩张、采矿和砍伐树木的有权势的政治家和领导人。
有些人将自然视为无所不包的混沌。另一些人认为它是一种珍贵的平衡。还有一些人相信自然以血腥的愿景在我们中间行走——一个没有人类文明的未来。这个化身就是安萨西娅(Anthracia)，一个渴望复仇的树精。她领导着一支被她称为荒野族(Wilderkith)的自然复仇者力量。

entries.name: Background
entries: 当凡人们砍伐了平凡世界中的第一片森林，为了修路，安妮瑟莎（Anthracia）对他们进行了毁灭，因为他们竟敢伤害自然界。为了她的罪行，一群大精灵将她囚禁在宝石洞穴（Gemhollow）里——这是阿卡迪亚（Arcadia）深处的一块古老水晶，那是精灵的领域。千年来，她看着文明兴起，看着人们试图驯服自然而伤害它。她的愤怒和对复仇的渴望不断滋生，直到一群好奇的精灵将她解放。
这位怀恨在心的树精向精灵、植物和森林精灵求助，希望他们帮助她拯救平凡世界免受人类扩张的威胁。那些认同树精言论的人们与安萨西亚一起离开阿卡迪亚，开始了一场血腥的战役。

entries.name: Goals
entries: 荒野族（Wilderkith）的内部圈子（Inner Circle）率领一支军队，摧毁文明的污点，毁坏道路、水坝、农场，甚至学校。对于这个团体来说，焚烧一座城市是一种纯粹的善举，因为灰烬为下一代植物让路，让自然的循环得以延续。
荒野精灵(Wilderkith)鄙视那些砍伐树木、挖矿或试图驯服或掠夺大地的人。他们的信条对这些人毫无希望，认为他们注定会毁灭自己和周围的世界。
最终，狂野精灵们知道他们并不像凡间世界所有主要文明那样强大。仅凭他们的破坏行为无法扭转局势，但没有其他团体拥有结束文明疾病的勇气。狂野精灵寻求任何能帮助他们恢复未被驯服的荒野、统治它并防止未来文明崛起的力量。

entries.name: Methods
entries: 野性族依赖游击战，利用他们对土地的了解来获得优势。他们在深夜袭击防御薄弱的定居点，在撤退到森林后摧毁一切，然后返回到宝石洞穴。这个水晶监狱曾经关押着安萨西亚，但野性族将其变成了一座堡垒—他们可以通过仪式召唤到新的位置。
偶尔，狂野精灵族(Wilderkith)将目标对准更大的目标，利用破坏向那些认为自己安全在高大石墙后的人传递信息。快速植物生长重新夺回新鲜废墟是狂野精灵族(Wilderkith)常用的标志。

entries.name: Anthracia, Princess of Venom
entries: 对她的追随者们来说，树精{@creature Anthracia, Princess of Venom|FleeMortals|Anthracia}是迷人的，对待敌人却是残忍的，她乐于看到那些她视为对野兽和植物构成威胁的人的死亡。对于这位自封的毒姬来说，谋杀只是自然循环的一部分。只有那些与自然世界有联系的生物才能免受她的愤怒，但她觉得所有追随者最终都是可以牺牲的。
Anthracia（安萨西亚）的树精树隐藏在宝石洞穴（Gemhollow）的深处。她极力守护这棵树，只允许伐木工（Logger）进入密室。
安妮西亚(Anthracia)通过与大地的超自然联系，远程控制战场，锁定地形并操纵敌人和盟友的移动。

entries.name: Logger
entries: 由安萨西亚树的藤蔓和树枝制成，{@creature Logger|FleeMortals} 忠实地跟随着树精，就像一只小狗一样。这个植物人形从未离开过她的身边，并与安萨西亚一起被囚禁了数千年。
当Anthracia命令(%num%)攻击时，记录者温顺的态度会转变为暴怒。一旦释放，这个植物就很难控制；充满了自然本身的狂暴愤怒，它们容易暴走，踩踏友军和敌人。
木匠在战斗中喜欢直面敌人，准备好为狂野精灵族承受伤害，并尽可能固定住更多目标。

entries.name: Sylphise
entries: {@creature Sylphise|FleeMortals} 作为安萨西亚(Anthracia)的副手，她是超凡脱俗、令人不安的外星存在。那些瞥见这位森林仙女的人，回忆起这一幕时更多的是恐惧而非敬畏，他们讲述着一个扣人心弦的噩梦，描述着那些不可思议的长臂、有爪手指和宽大、能刺破灵魂的眼睛。
Sylphise（(Sylphise)）视大多数其他生物为她不屑一顾的昆虫，或者是她娱乐的玩具。即使是精灵和精灵也很难理解她，许多人私下里互相低声耳语，说着这位仙女混乱的本质是一个负担——但没有人会向Anthracia（(Anthracia)）提出这个建议，因为树精和仙女对彼此完全忠诚。
没有人能质疑她在战场上的成绩。Sylphise像蛇一样迅速地袭击，像舞者一样在战斗中穿梭，留下恐惧。

entries.name: Tuval-Uthriar
entries: {@creature Tuval-Uthriar|FleeMortals}曾是一位自豪的圣骑士团指挥官，但在一位土地男爵入侵他家族的古老领地并杀死他的儿子后，他离开了职位，开始训练安萨西亚(Athracia)的部队。这位精灵宣誓成为复仇的工具，誓言要对文明的傲慢进行报复。他是内部圈子的最新成员，在平凡世界(Mundane World)度过了他的一生。
这位资深战术家相信狂野精灵族（Wilderkith）的使命是摧毁人类，从而阻止自然世界的缓慢衰败。然而，当被命令伤害另一个精灵时，他不禁看到自己家人的面孔，他很难服从。
除了图瓦尔-乌斯瑞尔(Tuval-Uthriar)有限的治疗能力外，他通过吸引火力并形成坚实的前线来支持狂野精灵(Wilderkith)。

entries.name: Vali
entries: 一位曾经因弑兄而被部落谴责的猎人，{@creature Vali|FleeMortals} 现在是Wilderkith部族中备受推崇的侦察员和刺客。这位精灵擅长用他的魔法长弓从树梢上击倒敌人。
瓦利在被(Vali)逐出教会后发誓保持沉默，但他的脸上刻着明确的优先事项。他活在杀戮之中，最快乐的时刻是看着一具尸体倒下。对于这位嗜血的刺客来说，每一次死亡都来得不够快。
在战斗中，瓦利(`Vali`)很难被发现，更难被击中。他有很多选择来摆脱困境，使他成为一个特别难缠的伤害输出者。

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: 图瓦尔-乌斯里亚尔挥舞着一只名为{@item eye of sunrise|FleeMortals}的魔法臂铠，瓦利则挥舞着一把名为{@item waning moon|FleeMortals}的魔法长弓。
{@item Eye of Sunrise|FleeMortals}
{@item Waning Moon|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Wilderkith Villain Actions
entries: 荒野精灵有五种恶棍派对行动。在敌人的回合之后，派对可以在遭遇中每次采取一次行动。派对可以以任何顺序采取这些行动，但每轮只能使用一次。只有在执行该行动的生物在遭遇中且不是{@condition incapacitated}时，才能采取行动。

items.name: Action 1: Liquid Earth
entries: 在Anthracia的60英尺范围内的每个生物必须成功通过一次DC 17的敏捷豁免才能免受她的影响，被移动最多15英尺水平距离。目标可以选择放弃这次豁免。

items.name: Action 2: Distracting Tendrils
entries: 记录者（Logger）疯狂地挥动着它们的触须。在它们周围30英尺范围内的每个敌人必须进行一次17 DC敏捷豁免检定。未通过豁免的目标将受到22({@damage 4d10})点割伤伤害，并在目标的下一个回合结束前对攻击投掷有劣势。通过豁免的目标只会受到一半伤害，且不会受到其他影响。

items.name: Action 3:  Blood-Soaked Daisies
entries: Sylphise（西尔菲丝）移动她的速度而不会引发机会攻击。她可以对在移动过程中距离她5英尺以内的每个敌人进行一次爪击攻击。

items.name: Action 4: Tactical Push
entries: 图瓦尔-乌斯里亚尔大喊一声命令。在他周围60英尺内并能听到他的内圈成员可以进行一次攻击或者移动，移动距离不超过他们的速度（无需动作）。

items.name: Action 5: Suppressing Volley
entries: 瓦利对他能看到的每个敌人进行远程攻击，射程为150英尺，内圈成员每人可以移动其速度并执行躲藏动作（无需动作）。
{@creature Anthracia, Princess of Venom|FleeMortals}
{@creature Logger|FleeMortals}

entries.name: What is Logger?
entries: 木工人是一种由安萨西亚从她的树枝上创造出来的独一无二的植物生物。只有安萨西亚真正理解用来创造这种植物的魔法，但有些人推测，如果安萨西亚的树被摧毁，木工人也会因此而死。在同一次打击中失去她的树和木工人肯定会让安萨西亚不惜一切地寻求复仇。
{@creature Sylphise|FleeMortals}
当血液在你周围汇集时，泥土将会吸收它！至少你还对某事有用。(The dirt)
{@creature Tuval-Uthriar|FleeMortals}
{@creature Vali|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Amethyst Knife
entries: {@i Optimized for Five 11th-Level Characters}
在一次冒险远征出了差错后，冒险者们获得了奇怪的超能力。利用他们新获得的能力，他们建立了被称为紫水晶刀(Amethyst Knife)的犯罪集团。该集团的无情自私的领导者们努力成为已知世界中最富有和最强大的组织之一，操纵竞争对手派系、国家元首和其他有权势的个人，使他们屈服于该集团的控制之下。

entries.name: Background
entries: 五年前，著名的半身人演员和冒险家哈洛·蜜笑(`Harlo Honeygrin`)组织了一次探险，寻找一座古老废墟及传闻中的外星文明遗物。哈洛和他的探险队发现了一把由紫色水晶制成的匕首，与他们以往见过的任何东西都不同。当他们从石台上取下这把奇怪的武器时，雷鸣般的能量使宝库倒塌，匕首也碎裂开来，释放出一股紫色灵能的爆炸脉冲。
在从爆炸中恢复并逃离废墟后，五名幸存者发现他们获得了奇怪的新能力和一种共享的心灵感应联系。随着这一新发展，哈洛（Harlo）揭示了他作为一个小型犯罪组织头目的真实本性。他说服其他人利用他们的新能力来帮助扩大和壮大他的团伙的影响力——当然是在分享利润和权力的前提下。他们将该组织重新命名为那件赋予他们新能力和机会的奇怪外星遗物的名字，一起，他们将哈洛的小型犯罪企业重塑成一个蓬勃发展的地下帝国。

entries.name: Goals
entries: 紫晶匕首（The Amethyst Knife）最看重三样东西：财富、影响力和控制。他们愿意通过任何必要手段获得这些，对于谁会受伤或者在过程中必须牺牲什么并不在乎。对于匕首来说，目的总是正当手段。
这个（Amethyst Knife）团伙一直在扩大他们的间谍、线人和受控有影响力的人的网络。最近，他们把目光投向了首都大港城的贵族家族，派遣间谍和手下渗透这些家族，寻找新的机会。

entries.name: Methods
entries: 紫晶刀（Amethyst Knife）在各种犯罪计划中积累财富：走私、保护费、刺杀合同等等。然后，该组织的老板们将这些犯罪企业的资金投资到合法企业中——由于紫晶刀胁迫当地领导制定有利法律，并吓跑竞争对手，这些合法企业证明非常赚钱。
在紫晶匕首（Amethyst Knife）的老板们不让任何事情阻挡他们的道路，他们却避免引起太多注意。该团体使用诡计和棋子来避免法律执法部门和所谓的英雄的愤怒。贿赂或勒索知名人物、颠覆法律和合同、威胁亲人、并将目标置于绝望境地是所有常见的策略。
当微妙的操控失败时，紫晶刀会以迅猛无情的暴力打击他们的敌人。小威胁和障碍可以通过自由职业刺客或雇佣兵解决，但严重的对抗需要紫晶刀的上司介入。他们利用自己的超能力、共享的思维和多样的技能，等待着一个脆弱的时刻。如果一次袭击失败，紫晶刀会褪去阴影，寻找更好的方法——比如逐个慢慢消灭对手团体。

entries.name: Harlo Honeygrin
entries: 尽管{@creature Harlo Honeygrin|FleeMortals}快要迎来他的一百二十岁生日，他仍然保持着年轻英俊的半身人外表。他公开形象是一个迷人、英勇、热爱艺术的人，但事实上，哈洛是一个嫉妒、恶毒的败类，秘密创建了一个犯罪企业来满足他虚荣和绝望的需求。
八十多年前，哈洛（Harlo）与巴雷斯奎斯（Barresqueth）达成了一项协议，后者是一位大精灵，提供给这位贫困的半身人名望、权力和美貌，作为交换，需要每三年支付一笔宝藏。在达成协议后，哈洛建立了他一直想要的戏剧和冒险生活，但当第一笔付款到期时，哈洛发现巴雷斯奎斯会每三年增加价格。随着费用的增长，哈洛不得不诉诸犯罪手段来获取宝藏。
每次巴雷斯奎斯（Barresqueth）向哈洛（Harlo）收取债务时，这位大精灵都会变成一个戴着眼罩的剑客老鼠的模样。路人们会以为这只小老鼠是哈洛可爱的精灵朋友，这只会让这位半身人更加恼火，当他把一袋财富交给这只贪婪的小老鼠时。
哈洛（Harlo）保持着作为一名著名演员的生活，利用这一身份在刀会（the Knife）试图控制的社会中建立联系。当被迫采取行动时，他会在隐藏中使用自己的能力，而其他老板则会与对手正面交锋。

entries.name: Jutkarr Flintfingers
entries: 尽管{@creature Jutkarr Flintfingers|FleeMortals}是一个信奉拉吉洛（Ragilo）的虔诚信徒，这位神受到了盗贼和刺客的崇拜，但他并不认为自己是一个恶棍。事实上，这位像祖父般慈祥的矮人并不喜欢大多数盗贼，称他们为懒惰的骗子和傲慢的撒谎者。朱特卡尔（Jutkarr）认为自己是一个"问题解决者"，并相信任何真正的拉吉洛信徒也是如此。对他来说，在解决城市报纸上的日常字谜和"解决"一座受到保护的豪宅、一个被施了结界的宝藏库，或者街头帮派战争的社会复杂性之间几乎没有什么区别。每一种情况只是一种愉快的消遣，也是保持头脑敏锐的机会。
Harlo雇佣了Jutkarr作为他的探险队中的内部陷阱和锁专家。在发现紫水晶刀之后，Jutkarr成为了辛迪加的军需官和战术家。他凭借着狡猾的智慧和洞察力监督大部分行动。

entries.name: Llyvessa
entries: {@creature Llyvessa|FleeMortals}，月光跃影者，是紫水晶匕首团队中最神秘的成员。这位精灵的异世外表在迷人和可怕之间变化。她通常用晦涩的精灵短语和比喻说话，大多数人觉得难以理解。
Llyvessa（利维莎）和Harlo（哈洛）在哈洛即将启程的探险队中，当导游神秘失踪时，她作为最后一刻的替补出现而相遇。当团队发现水晶匕首时，利维莎被一种无法言喻的恐惧和敬畏所震撼，仿佛她能看到其他人看不到的东西。从那时起，她一直无条件遵循其他人的命令，并没有努力分享自己的感受或抱负。她在组织中的真正意图仍然是一个谜。
As a deadly sharpshooter, Llyvessa serves as one of the Amethyst Knife's top assassins, killing with a detached, calculating efficiency.

entries.name: Treyvan von Hirnschmann
entries: {@creature Treyvan von Hirnschmann|FleeMortals} is the illegitimate half-elf son of Duke Zaltz von Hirnschmann, a minor but influential human noble. To prove himself worthy of a noble title—and of his father's love—Treyvan set out to seek his own fortune. He eventually crossed blades with Victory Graves in a duel, and though Treyvan lost, Vic saw potential in him. Instead of killing the man, she offered him a job on an expedition led by her employer Harlo Honeygrin.

After the expedition, Treyvan initially declined Harlo's offer to join the Amethyst Knife, intending to head home and use his new powers to prove himself to his father. However, Harlo and Victory brought Treyvan evidence of an assassination plot against him—one orchestrated by his father the duke, who hoped to remove Treyvan as a threat to his younger half-sibling's title. Crushed and enraged at the betrayal, Treyvan agreed to join the Amethyst Knife. Seeking revenge, he plans to use the criminal empire to usurp control of his father's domain.

entries.name: Humanoid Ability Scores Above 20
entries: The Humanoids in the Amethyst Knife, Soulbinders, and Hallowed Dark have ability scores above 20. Each party has experienced an accident or event that made its members superhuman and bound their fates together.

entries.name: Victory "Vic" Graves
entries: {@creature Victory Graves|FleeMortals|Victory} grew up in a rough orphanage that forced her onto the streets as soon as the young human could feed and dress herself. Her childhood instilled what she considers life's most valuable lesson: "The weak think someone will save them. The strong think others will fear them. The clever think everyone beneath them. In the end, it's the ruthless who survive."

Vic learned to fight as soon as she could lift a blade, and she honed her skills in vicious backroom fighting pits and bloody alleyway brawls. She delights in luring foes into oneon-one duels with her, where her sharp reflexes and precise strikes prove deadly. These skills earned her employment as a bodyguard for Harlo when he began his criminal career. Long before the founding of the Amethyst Knife, Vic recognized Harlo's true nature and the commonality in their merciless and selfish values, and she agreed to serve as his second-in-command, a position she has held ever since.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: After returning from their fateful expedition, two members of the Amethyst Knife used the shattered remains of the crystal dagger to forge psionic items for themselves. Harlo Honeygrin carries the {@item amethyst die|FleeMortals}, and Victory wields {@item mindrazor|FleeMortals}.
{@item Amethyst Die|FleeMortals}
{@item Mindrazor|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Amethyst Knife Villain Actions
entries: The Amethyst Knife has five villain party actions. The party can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. The party can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round. An action can be taken only if the creature performing it is present in the encounter and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

items.name: Action 1: Amethyst Formation
entries: Treyvan telekinetically moves each willing Amethyst Knife boss who he can see within 60 feet of him up to 30 feet in any direction.

items.name: Action 2: Leaves Fall on the Moon
entries: Llyvessa shoots an arrow charged with psionic potential, creating a line of psionic energy that is 5 feet wide and 150 feet long. Each enemy in that area must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Action 3: I Planned For This
entries: Jutkarr issues a coded telepathic instruction and psionically manipulates the space around him. Each Amethyst Knife boss within 60 feet of him can teleport and swap spaces with another willing Amethyst Knife boss in that area (no action required). Each teleporting creature must be able to see the creature they're swapping spaces with.

items.name: Action 4: Telepathic Tirade
entries: Victory telepathically taunts one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. Until the end of the target's next turn, they have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws, and they take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage whenever they fail an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

items.name: Action 5: Epilogue
entries: Harlo unleashes a chain of psionic fury. Each enemy within 60 feet of him must make a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}.
{@creature Harlo HoneyGrin|FleeMortals}
{@creature Jutkarr Flintfingers|FleeMortals}
Thieves? No. Thieves dream of doing one big, easy job. If they pull it off, they go into hiding and retire. We are not thieves. We're architects.
{@creature Llyvessa|FleeMortals}
{@creature Treyvan von Hirnschmann|FleeMortals}
{@creature Victory Graves|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Soulbinders
entries: {@i Optimized for Five 13th-Level Characters}

entries.name: Content Warning: Possession
entries: The Soulbinders are a once-humanoid collective transformed into sapient, cursed magic items. They possess, transform, and burn the life force of their wielders. If your group would rather avoid the topic of possession, you can instead make the Soulbinders power-hungry warriors whose magic weapons draw on their own life force.

The timeless quest for immortality takes countless forms, many of which serve as cautionary tales. In the case of the Soulbinders, their ignorance and greed bound their souls into cursed items that feed off the life force of their wielders.

entries.name: Background
entries: Millennia ago, the Soulbinders were a mortal band of explorers. Prince Ellan Farra traveled with his sage advisor, a duo of mercenaries, and a spelunker guide to find their eternal reward—a scroll containing an ancient ritual to grant immortality.

When the party found the ancient text, their ambition blinded them to the ritual's true cost. Each explorer offered a personal treasure, expecting the ritual to consume it. Instead, as the scroll disintegrated, the spell destroyed their bodies and trapped their souls in these objects. Worse, the Soulbinders learned that to fuel their power and truly experience immortal life, they must consume the souls of others, puppeteering the body of each unsuspecting victim until their life force burns out.

entries.name: Goals
entries: No record shows how long the Soulbinders have existed, and even they have long forgotten. Unsatisfied with their cursed existence, their hunger remains unsated, for their immortality means nothing without power. The Soulbinders have resolved to achieve godhood, escape their prisons, and elevate their souls to a higher existence.

The Soulbinders believe that in forcing people to worship them as gods, they will in fact become gods. Their main goal is to bring new lands and peoples under their control, then use those resources to acquire even more. The group also searches for new sources of magical power that might hasten their deification.

entries.name: Methods
entries: The Soulbinders' unquenchable ambitions and dark magics often require the sacrifice of innocents or other unspeakable acts of violence.

To function, each Soulbinder also needs a body to possess and transform into their old self—and to acquire such a body, a hapless mortal must attune to the cursed item that binds the villain's soul. Once possessed, the victim remains distressingly aware of their former body's actions. The Soulbinders who have obtained bodies aid those who lack one, often by offering unsuspecting adventurers a cursed item as a reward or by planting it where it might be discovered by a chosen traveler. After possessing a user, the victim's soul is consumed over time and the bodies eventually burn out into dust.

{@b {@i Blackstone Manor.}} The Soulbinders operate from a fortified mansion they call Blackstone Manor, built from the old temple ruins where they first discovered the cursed ritual. A secret passage in the manor's cellar hides the Walk of Bones, an ancient vault and shrine bearing walls inlaid with ash and bone fragments from the Soulbinders' possessed victims.

entries.name: Argan Rael
entries: Obsessed with uncovering forbidden magical secrets, {@creature Argan Rael|FleeMortals} was shunned by every mage circle he approached for help. Seeking to make fools of his detractors, the tiefling made a desperate case to Prince Ellan Farra, promising to find the secrets of immortality. Taken by the idea of ruling eternally, the prince agreed to support Argan and called for the execution of those who doubted the mage's wisdom.
While knowledge is Argan's passion, his biggest thrill is causing suffering and subjugation. He is loyal to the Soulbinders but takes orders only from Prince Ellan.
The callous wizard prefers to possess other spellcasters, and he resides within the {@item bracers of the spellbreaker|FleeMortals}.

entries.name: Kishina Darrowind
entries: When {@creature Kishina Darrowind|FleeMortals} was just a young half-elf, her homeland was invaded by the long-lived elf Oramac. She vowed to make the commander pay for his crimes and to outlive him and his kin. Retreating into the wilderness, Kishina struck and killed small bands of Oramac's forces when she could, but as age took its toll on her, her vow for eternal vengeance seemed an angry child's dream. One day, however, Prince Ellan Farra arrived at her door in need of a guide to an ancient ruin.

Now a conqueror herself, Kishina barely thinks about the vengeance she swore or the home she lost. She has become level-headed and dispassionate, willing to justify any action as a means to an end. Godhood is her only passion, though if she could be reminded of how she felt about conquerors in days past, she might hate what she has become.

Kishina is bound to her {@item pathfinder's boots|FleeMortals} and wishes to learn the origin of the ritual that changed her. Was it planar magic? The act of a trickster god? Or something even more unfathomable? If she could find that answer, she's confident she would not only understand that power, but perhaps even learn to wield it.

entries.name: Prince Ellan Farra
entries: King Garrow Farra always saw {@creature Prince Ellan Farra|FleeMortals|Prince Ellan}, his eldest child, for what he was: a power-hungry narcissist. When Garrow declared that Ellan's younger siblings would take the crown, the elf prince's narcissism turned to fury. Ellan went to war with his father and siblings—and nearly lost. Before he could finish doing so, however, Ellan learned of Argan's research and the chance at immortality it offered. Ellan abandoned his decimated armies in favor of a new plan: he would become immortal, go into hiding, and outlive his pathetic siblings before emerging to claim the throne forever.

Countless years have passed, and finally, the prince stands ready to seize the throne his father ripped from his hands. But his ambitions have broadened, and now the throne is simply one rung on the ladder to Ellan's godhood.

Though pretentious, callous, and selfish, Ellan is no fool. Both methodical and ruthless, he seeks not only control, but the reverence he believes his due. Ellan is bound to the {@item crown of majesty|FleeMortals}, a magic circlet whose name befits the prince's ego.

entries.name: Radlee "The Grim" Thugram
entries: {@creature Radlee Thugram|FleeMortals} was one of the countless human subjects who King Garrow conscripted and sent to war against the forces of Prince Ellan. Radlee's unit perished when her ruthless commander set them up as bait in an enemy ambush. Thanks to Radlee's quick thinking, she was the only survivor—and she celebrated her escape by returning to camp and murdering her commander.

After that, Radlee deserted and became a sellsword, quickly earning a frightening reputation. The few survivors of her brutality often simply called her "the Grim." The bloody road of mercenary work led Radlee into partnership with the Scarlet Shadow, a mysterious assassin for hire. Their infamy grew, and one day, the very prince Radlee had been forced to fight came inquiring about a job exploring a remote ruin.

Radlee is cold and matter-of-fact, and despises social platitudes—traits which sometimes put her at odds with the prince. In combat, she is ferocious and unrelenting, protecting her fellow Soulbinders while showing no mercy to her enemies. She is bound to the {@item visionary's cloak|FleeMortals}.

entries.name: Scarlet Shadow
entries: {@creature Scarlet Shadow|FleeMortals} doesn't share his name or background. Only the dragonborn's closest friend, Radlee Thugram, knows he once belonged to an assassin's guild that bore his name. After a bloody guild war left Scarlet as his organization's only survivor, he took on the guild's name as his own and became an independent contract killer. Eventually, Scarlet joined forces with Radlee and then the rest of the Soulbinders.

Long before Scarlet's curse, he'd already lost most of his humanity. Killing is his only purpose and sadistic pleasure, and he doesn't want to be just any god—he wants to be the god of death. The assassin is bound to the {@item ring of scarlet shadows|FleeMortals}, the last symbol of his old guild.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: Each Soulbinder wears a magic item that houses their eternal soul:

items: {@creature Argan Rael|FleeMortals}: {@item bracers of the spellbreaker|FleeMortals}
{@creature Kishina Darrowind|FleeMortals}: {@item pathfinder's boots|FleeMortals}
{@creature Prince Ellan Farra|FleeMortals}: {@item crown of majesty|FleeMortals}
{@creature Radlee Thugram|FleeMortals|Radlee "The Grim" Thugram}: {@item  visionary's cloak|FleeMortals}
{@creature Scarlet Shadow|FleeMortals}: {@item ring of scarlet shadows|FleeMortals}

entries: If a Soulbinder's body is killed, their magic item can be recovered as treasure. In addition to the properties listed in the magic item descriptions, each item has the following two properties.
{@b {@i Sentience.}} This magic item is sentient. Its alignment and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores match the corresponding persona's stat block.

This magic item has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. It can speak, read, and understand the languages in its persona's stat block, and it can communicate telepathically with its wearer.

{@b {@i Curse.}} Once you attune to this item, you can't end your attunement to it unless you are targeted by the {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. Seven days after you attune to it, you must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, your Wisdom score is reduced by 1 for as long as you remain attuned to the item. You must repeat this saving throw every 24 hours while you remain attuned to the item.

If you fail this saving throw three times, the magic item possesses your body, and your soul becomes trapped in your body. Your body transforms into the original body of the soul within the magic item, and your statistics change to match the persona in control of your new body. While possessed, your equipment transforms into the equipment used by the possessing persona's stat block. You sense everything your body can sense, but the persona controls your movement, speech, and actions.

If you end your attunement to the magic item, your body returns to its original form, you regain control of your body, and the magic item's soul returns to the magic item. If you die, the magic item's soul returns to the magic item. If your body is possessed for {@dice 1d6 + 12} months, your soul is destroyed, your body crumbles to dust, and you die.

entries.name: It's Not Me!
entries: Even after a Soulbinder's magic item settles its curse on a new victim, the Soulbinder must wait until the victim's will weakens enough for possession. In the meantime, the Soulbinder builds a friendly relationship with their wearer, striving to convince them that the curse is caused by some other magical force in their life. Since the ill effects of the curse don't manifest for days, it's usually easy to blame the curse on other newly acquired objects or recent events.
{@item Bracers of the Spellbreaker|FleeMortals}
{@item Crown of Majesty|FleeMortals}
{@item Pathfinder's Boots|FleeMortals}
{@item Ring of Scarlet Shadows|FleeMortals}
{@item Visionary's Cloak|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Soulbinder Items and Stat Blocks
entries: While possessing a body, the Soulbinders wear their respective magic items. However, since each Soulbinder is the item they wear, they can harness the power more effectively than their magic item's normal statistics allow. This makes the Soulbinders powerful villains and simplifies their stat blocks. This means you don't need to track charges or worry about a cloak's hood remaining up during combat.

entries.name: Soulbinders Villain Actions
entries: The Soulbinders have five villain party actions. The party can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. The party can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round. An action can be taken only if the creature performing it is present in the encounter and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

items.name: Action 1: Battle Cry
entries: Ellan unleashes a cacophonous battle cry. Each enemy within 60 feet of him who can hear him must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Action 2: Strategic Positioning
entries: Radlee and each ally within 60 feet of her who can see or hear her can move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks and take the Hide action.

items.name: Action 3: Furious Dance
entries: Kishina unleashes a flurry of spinning attacks against each enemy she can see within 15 feet of her. Each target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and aren't knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Action 4: Gravity Bomb
entries: Argan creates an explosion of negative energy centered on a point he can see within 90 feet of him. Each enemy in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) force damage and their speed is reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and their speed isn't reduced.

items.name: Action 5: Shadow Shift
entries: Scarlet Shadow teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see and makes one Shadow Blade or Razor Garrote attack with advantage. If the attack hits, it is a critical hit.

entries.name: Ending the Curse for Good
entries: The characters might wish to permanently uncurse the Soulbinders' magic items to free the souls trapped within the items, or to make the items usable without the threat of possession. At your discretion, the characters can permanently remove the Sentience and Curse properties of each item by finding a second copy of the ritual scroll that trapped the Soulbinders. Performing this ritual near all five items restores each Soulbinder's original body and transfers their souls out of the items back into their bodies. After this occurs, the scroll is reduced to ash and the Sentience and Curse properties of each item are removed.
{@creature Argan Rael|FleeMortals}
{@creature Kishina Darrowind|FleeMortals}
{@creature Prince Ellan Farra|FleeMortals}
{@creature Radlee Thugram|FleeMortals}
{@creature Scarlet Shadow|FleeMortals}

entries.name: Hallowed Dark
entries: {@i Optimized for Five 15th-Level Characters}

entries.name: Content Warning: Terrorism, Torture, and Blood
entries: As the Hallowed Dark prepares the world for the return of the dragon {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}, they instill fear through destruction, murder, and torture. If you or your players wouldn't enjoy a game with such themes, you should focus the cult's actions on the ritual to bring back the dragon instead of terrorism and torture.
Draven Malas is a blood mage who can boil the blood of his foes. If such descriptions would ruin the fun for anyone in your group, his magic can affect the energy and vitality of foes instead.

For every adventurer standing against the oncoming dark, there is a fervid wretch seeking the world's annihilation. Five such zealots serve the gloom dragon {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}. Empowered by drinking the wyrm's blood, the apocalypse cult of the Hallowed Dark now seeks to usher in the Silent Decay's reign of suffocating darkness.

entries.name: Background
entries: For many, the Sun Eater was a figure of mere myth and nightmare—but not for Aronar and Athmia Valkys, halfelf twins born under an eclipse. Every birthday brought them whispered promises of power and visions of a dragon swallowing the sun. The twins traveled deep to a forgotten underground temple where they found vials of {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}'s blood. In a profane ritual, the twins each consumed a vial of blood; in return, {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} set one of the wyrm's eyes in each of their heads, granting them supernatural powers. The wyrm also bestowed magical rings on the twins as a mark of favor.

Though Aronar and Athmia were {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}'s first priests of the modern age, the dragon sent similar whispers to three more chosen. Each arrived at the slumbering wyrm's church and gained a dragon's blessings: the tiefling Caithas grew wings, Vivienn's human body was empowered with dragon sinew, and Draven's human blood was replaced with that of a dragon.
Together, they are the Hallowed Dark—and they will expunge every trace of light from this world.

entries.name: Goals
entries: The Hallowed Dark ultimately wish to restore {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} to power and end this wretched world. In exchange, the dragon promises dominion over the shadowed world to come.

Methodical, patient, and cruel, the cultists know the path to the lightless world is a long and arduous one—and in the meantime, they relish the suffering they inflict on their path to forever dark. This apocalypse cult commands as much terror as the Sun Eater they seek to reawaken, becoming nightmares for all who cross their path.

entries.name: Methods
entries: {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} communicates intermittently with the Hallowed Dark through visions, dreams, and impressions, drawing their priests to dark corners of the world. In these remote places, the cult enacts a series of costly and prolonged rituals to reawaken the Silent Decay. The rituals require rare, void-touched components: fallen stars and meteorites, the hearts or minds of eldritch entities, deep-mined iron wielded by those who travel between planes, and more.

Meanwhile, the cult spreads darkness and fear. They believe terror crushes hope, and without hope, people  will buckle when the end approaches. The Hallowed Dark has committed many atrocities—terrorist attacks on temples and government buildings, destruction of systems that provide societal structure and safety, wanton slaughter, and torture of those they bother to leave alive. If the whimpering mortals they spare go wailing to others about {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}'s return—well, all the better.

entries.name: Aronar Valkys
entries: {@creature Aronar Valkys|FleeMortals} is a prodigy spellcaster, born under an eclipse and rumored to have thieved magic from the gods themselves in the night. The half-elf keeps no holy symbol and worships at no temple, yet he commanded divine magic long before he supped on {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}'s blood. Aronar scorns spellcasters who chain themselves to the gods, claiming that the secrets of heaven await anyone cunning enough to claim them.

He proudly wields the right eye of {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}, which grants the gift of clarity of mind and the wisdom of dragons. It was {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}'s promises of knowledge that drew Aronar to follow them—he saw visions of himself and Athmia shaping the new world with magic no mortal possessed, becoming figures of unimaginable nightmare.

Aronar's calm demeanor belies his arrogance and narcissism. He longs for nothing more than unchecked dominion in the new world. Cunning and careful, the halfelf sees all with his draconic eye and bides his time.

entries.name: Athmia Valkys
entries: While Aronar lusts after the mastery of magic, {@creature Athmia Valkys|FleeMortals|Athmia} needs no grand display to kill, just a single touch on her victim's mind. From childhood, she was a silent killer, rending the minds of small animals to sharpen her cognitive blades. Her arts of mental assassination allow her to tear down mental barriers and gouge out secrets without lifting a hand, leaving behind corpses with bleeding ears.

Her discretion and lethality earned her {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}'s left eye, a gift of shrewdness and stealth. In her visions, she saw her dark gifts praised, her ascendancy assured—and power, so much power for her insatiable mind.

Athmia allows Aronar to act as the cult's outward-facing "leader," but they work as equals—Aronar the politicking manipulator, Athmia the blade in the dark. During the rare times she speaks, she shows herself to be merciless, cold, and wholly devoted to the end of the world.

entries.name: Caithas
entries: Born from a deal with a devil, {@creature Caithas|FleeMortals}'s mother hid him from the militantly devout people of his small hometown. The tiefling lived under the floors of his mother's house, nurturing his creativity and filling those dark spaces with drawings of what he imagined the world looked like.

Then, at the age of eleven, he was discovered. The prejudiced people of the town chased Caithas into the wilds, where he nearly starved before learning to forage. During those dark months, {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} spoke to him in dreams. The gloom dragon taught him not only to hunt and survive, but to thrive. As Caithas grew, he became a keen hunter, and the mysterious dragon in his dreams was his sole friend.

Caithas was the first cultist Aronar and Athmia welcomed into the fold. While Caithas lacks the depth of the others' cruelty and ambitions, {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} has spent a lifetime filling his head with dreams of a beautiful, shadowed world, and his loyalty to the dragon runs deep. Caithas often falls into wry humor that turns to mockery, a reflection of his deep distrust of mortalkind. He watches his back, even around the other cultists, and trusts only {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} with his safety.

entries.name: Draven Malas
entries: Had vengeance not consumed him so deeply, {@creature Draven Malas|FleeMortals} would've been heralded as a paragon. A prominent government figure and a sorcerer of some renown, he dabbled in blood magic, certain he would never be drawn into its tempting darkness. But when his son died in a bandit attack, Draven snapped. He hunted down the bandits and the guards who failed to protect his boy, cursing their blood and boiling each offender from the inside. He was branded a murderer and fled.

Lost in grief, Draven was perfectly vulnerable when {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} gave him dreams—visions of a world where no evils would go unpunished, where Draven's fury was righteous and right. These visions guided him to the cult.

{@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} gave Draven the weightiest blessing of all, the blessing of blood. After nearly dying during his transformation, he revived to find the blood of dragons empowering his body. Draven is reckless and driven by rage, pushing himself to his limits in combat. He tears down his enemies' hopes and defenses, leaving them vulnerable and afraid before they die.

entries.name: Vivienn Dirroze
entries: Raised by frivolous nobles in a cutthroat court, {@creature Vivienn Dirroze|FleeMortals} decided young that her ambitions pointed higher. Her peers were content to vie for political power and assassinate rivals, but Vivienn refused to rest until she beheaded the source of true power—the gods themselves.

Filled with unholy ardor, the young human searched the world for secrets of god-killing. Finding traces of {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}, she made her way to the forgotten temple, where she offered her greataxe to the Hallowed Dark in exchange for the privilege of slaughtering the gods during the death of the world. {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} accepted her terms—and it was only then that Vivienn first heard the dragon's whispers.

Vivienn doesn't want power, she wants conquest. She yearns to meet her match and surpass it. {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals}'s gifts allow the warrior to unleash a draconic bloodfrenzy. She gleefully toes the line between discipline and wildness, holiness and blasphemy, cutting down any who stand between her and the darkness.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} entrusted Aronar and Athmia with two rings: Aronar with the {@item Sun Eater's soul|FleeMortals} and Athmia with the {@item Sun Eater's mind|FleeMortals}.

entries.name: Hallowed Dark Villain Actions
entries: The Hallowed Dark has five villain party actions. The party can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. The party can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round. An action can be taken only if the creature performing it is present in the encounter and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

items.name: Action 1: Shadow Blessing
entries: Aronar chooses up to three members of the Hallowed Dark he can see within 120 feet of him. Each target can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see, and until the end of each target's next turn, they are covered in shadowy armor that grants them resistance to all damage and a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

items.name: Action 2: Dual Blades
entries: Athmia moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes two melee attacks.

items.name: Action 3: Hunter of Mortals
entries: Caithas imbues several arrows with draconic power. He can make one Scaled Longbow attack against each enemy within 600 feet of him. If any of these attacks reduces a target to 0 hit points, they die.

items.name: Action 4: Blood Drain
entries: Draven steals the vitality of one enemy he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) necrotic damage and is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}. Draven then restores a number of hit points equal to twice the necrotic damage dealt, divided however he chooses between himself and any member of the Hallowed Dark he can see within 60 feet of him.

items.name: Action 5: Wrath of the Godslayer
entries: Vivienn hurls her axe in a wrathful circle then compels it back into her hand. Each enemy within 30 feet of her must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) slashing damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries: You can find a stat block and more lore for {@creature Qazyldrath|FleeMortals} in {@book "Dragons"|FleeMortals|1|Dragons} in {@book chapter 1, "Creatures."|FleeMortals|1} You can build a whole campaign using the Hallowed Dark as the villains.

entries: The blade can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Slippery

trait.name: Toxiferous
entries: When a creature hits the blade with a melee attack while within 5 feet of them or touches the blade, that creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

entries: The needler can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Sniper
entries: If the needler misses with a ranged weapon attack while they are hidden, they remain hidden. Additionally, if the needler makes a ranged weapon attack with advantage and hits, the attack deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

trait.name: Toxiferous
entries: When a creature hits the needler with a melee attack while within 5 feet of them or touches the needler, that creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Poison Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 25/100 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage at the start of each of their turns.

bonus.name: Hop and Hide
entries: The needler jumps a number of feet up to their walking speed, then takes the Hide action.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The seer can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Third Eye
entries: Creatures within 30 feet of the seer can't hide from the seer. Creatures who can't be targeted by divination magic are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Toxiferous
entries: When a creature hits the seer with a melee attack while within 5 feet of them or touches the seer, that creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Acid Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage. If the target is a creature and they attack the seer before the start of the seer's next turn, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Refulgent Beam
entries: The seer fires two magical beams of radiant energy, each beam targeting a creature the seer can see within 120 feet of them. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage and shed dim light in a 10-foot radius for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While shedding light in this way, attack rolls against the target have advantage, the target can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}, and they can't take the Hide action.

action.name: Noxious Bubble (1/Day)
entries: The seer creates a 5-foot-radius sphere filled with toxic gas in an unoccupied space they can see within 60 feet of them. If undisturbed, this bubble lasts for 1 minute then dissipates harmlessly. If a creature attacks the bubble, touches it, enters its space, or otherwise disturbs it, the bubble bursts, and each creature within 15 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Psychedelic Drone (1/Day)
entries: Each enemy within 60 feet of the seer who can hear them must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

bonus.name: Hop
entries: The seer jumps a number of feet up to their walking speed.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The slink can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The slink can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Toxiferous
entries: When a creature hits the slink with a melee attack while within 5 feet of them or touches the slink, that creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slink makes one Poison Dagger attack and one Tongue Nab attack.

action.name: Poison Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Tongue Nab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}The slink grabs one Small or Tiny object the slink can see that the target is holding or carrying. The slink can catch the object if they have a free hand, otherwise it lands at the slink's feet.

bonus.name: Hop and Hide
entries: The slink jumps a number of feet up to their walking speed, then takes the Hide action.

trait.name: Acid Burst
entries: When the tadpole is reduced to 0 hit points, their body pops, spraying acid around them. Each creature within 5 feet of the tadpole takes 1 acid damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tadpole can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the tadpole takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the tadpole takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

trait.name: Noxious Skin
entries: When a creature starts their turn within 5 feet of three or more tadpoles, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of their next turn. The DC for this saving throw equals 10 plus the number of tadpoles within 5 feet of the creature.

action.name: Bite (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The clawfish can hold their breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage, and if the target is a Small or larger creature, the clawfish can pull themself into the target's space and attach to the target. While attached, the clawfish moves with the target without provoking opportunity attacks, and the clawfish can't make Claw attacks. A creature who can reach the clawfish can use an action to make a {@dc 12} Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. On a success, the clawfish is detached and shunted into an unoccupied space of the clawfish's choice within 5 feet of the target. The clawfish also detaches if they become {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition prone}, or {@condition restrained}, or if they use 5 feet of movement to detach.

action.name: Electrocute {@recharge}
entries: Each creature touching the clawfish takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage. If the clawfish is immersed in water, each other creature within 10 feet of the clawfish who is touching the same body of water must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage.

hp.special: Seven times their level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their level)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The angulotl yegg can breathe air and water.

action.name: Signature Attack (Poison Knife)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 plus PB} piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. Beginning at 7th level, the yegg can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Death from Above! (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the yegg jumps up to their walking speed without provoking opportunity attacks. If they leap over an enemy during this jump, the yegg can make a signature attack with advantage against that enemy. On a hit, this attack deals an extra {@damage 0d1 + PB|PB} piercing damage.

action.name: 5th Level: Lay Low (3/Day)
entries: When the yegg hits a creature with a signature attack while hidden, the yegg can use their reaction to remain hidden.

action.name: 7th Level: Excoriating Acid (3/Day)
entries: As an action, the yegg throws a flask of acid at a point they can see within 20 feet of them. The flask shatters, and each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 10 plus PB} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage PBd10} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

hp.special: 7 + seven times caregiver's level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their caregiver's level)

action.name: Signature Attack (Bite)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 plus PB} piercing damage.

action.name: 1st Level: Overwhelming Attack (2 Ferocity)
entries: The clawfish makes a signature attack. On a hit, the attack deals an extra {@damage 0d1 + PB|PB} lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of the clawfish's next turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Coiling Claws (5 Ferocity)
entries: The clawfish makes a signature attack against a Medium or smaller creature. On a hit, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 10 plus PB}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the clawfish can't make a signature attack against another target.

action.name: 5th Level: Lightning Bomb (8 Ferocity)
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of the clawfish must make a {@dc 10 plus PB} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage PBd8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Lightning Retaliation (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

The attacker must make a {@dc 10 plus PB} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage PBd6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: The camel has advantage on saving throws made to avoid or end the {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition prone} condition on themself.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Bilious Spit {@recharge 5}
entries: The camel vomits bile onto a creature they can see within 10 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). If the target fails the save by 5 or more, they are also {@condition blinded} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

monster.name: Deathhawk
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Corpse Sense
entries: Within a range of 5 miles, the deathhawk can sense the presence of Undead or corpses that have been dead for less than 90 days; the deathhawk knows the general direction these are in but not their exact locations. In addition, the deathhawk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to find Undead or corpses that have been dead for less than 90 days.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The deathhawk doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when they fly out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deathhawk makes one Beak attack and one Wounding Talons attack.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wounding Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature who isn't a Construct or an Undead, they gain a bleeding wound that lasts until they regain at least 1 hit point. A bleeding creature loses 5 ({@damage 1d10}) hit points for each bleeding wound they have at the start of their turn. Any creature who can reach the target can use an action to stanch all the target's wounds, ending the effect.

bonus.name: Bloodcurdling Shriek {@recharge}
entries: The deathhawk shrieks, and each enemy within 300 feet of the deathhawk who can hear them must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. Creatures who are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition automatically succeed on this saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is horrified for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While horrified, each time the creature makes an attack roll or a saving throw, they must roll a {@damage d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.
If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for them, they are immune to the Bloodcurdling Shriek of all deathhawks for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The eel can breathe air and water. They can survive out of water for up to 8 hours.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The eel has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or end the {@condition grappled} condition on themself.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Electric Pulse
entries: The eel channels energy toward a creature within 20 feet of them. The target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, made with disadvantage if the target is touching the eel. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage and is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}.

monster.name: Ancient Lightning Eel

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The eel can breathe air and water. They can survive out of water for up to 24 hours.

trait.name: Foudroyant Majesty (3/Day)
entries: When the eel fails a saving throw, they can succeed instead. When they do, they can't take the Multiattack action on their next turn.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The eel has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or end the {@condition grappled} condition on themself.

trait.name: Stormsurge
entries: Other lightning eels within 30 feet of the ancient eel deal an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage with their weapon attacks and Electric Pulse.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eel makes one Bite attack and uses Electric Pulse.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). While {@condition grappled}, the target is {@condition restrained} and the eel can't make a Bite attack against another target.

action.name: Electric Pulse
entries: The eel channels energy toward a creature within 60 feet of them. The creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, made with disadvantage if the target is touching the eel. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) lightning damage and is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}.

bonus.name: Coiling Storm
entries: The eel coils around a creature within 5 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}).

reaction.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: When another lightning eel that the ancient eel can see within 30 feet of them is reduced to 0 hit points, the ancient eel releases a crackling filament of lightning in their direction. The target is restored to life with 10 hit points. Each lighting eel can be restored to life only once with this reaction.

legendaryHeader: The eel has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Call to the Storm
entries: Every other lightning eel within 30 feet of the ancient eel can use their Electric Pulse action as a reaction.

legendary.name: Action 2: Electric Rush
entries: The eel surges with lightning, moves up to their speed, then makes a Bite attack. On a hit, the Bite attack deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage. A creature who hits the eel with a melee attack during this movement takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage.

legendary.name: Action 3: Fulminous Wave
entries: The eel releases a crackling wave of electricity and uses Electric Pulse against each enemy within 30 feet of them.

trait.name: Natural Camouflage
entries: The snowfox has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in snowy terrain or cloudy skies.

trait.name: Nimble Escape

While attached, the snowfox's Claw attacks against that target are made with advantage, and the snowfox can't attack another target. The target or a creature who can reach them can detach the snowfox as an action with a successful {@dc 13} Strength (Athletics) check. The snowfox can detach by spending 5 feet of their movement.

bonus.name: Burrow
