action.name: Command (2nd-Level Spell)
entries: Ellan speaks a one-word command to up to two creatures he can see within 60 feet of him.

Each target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on their next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is Undead, doesn't understand Common or Elvish, or would be directly harmed by following the command. If the target can't follow Ellan's command, the spell ends. Some typical commands and their effects follow:

items.name: Approach
entries: The target moves toward Ellan by the shortest and most direct route, ending their turn if they move within 5 feet of Ellan.

items.name: Drop
entries: The target drops whatever they are holding and then ends their turn.

items.name: Flee
entries: The target spends their turn moving away from Ellan by the fastest available means.

items.name: Grovel
entries: The target falls {@condition prone} and then ends their turn.

items.name: Halt
entries: The target doesn't move and takes no actions.

action.name: Unholy Flame (3rd-Level Spell)
entries: Ellan conjures unholy fire around one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) fire damage and is enveloped (save ends at end of turn). While enveloped, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of their turns. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't enveloped.

trait.name: Charm Resistant
entries: Kishina has advantage on saving throws she makes to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on herself.

trait.name: Light Landing
entries: Kishina takes no damage from falling.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: Kishina's long jump is up to 45 feet and her high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kishina makes four Unarmed Strike attacks or three Throwing Knife attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, or 20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage on a critical hit.

action.name: Throwing Knife
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d4 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Painful Sprint {@recharge}
entries: Kishina moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks, hitting a pressure point on each enemy she can see who she passes within 5 feet of during this move. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throwing or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of their next turn. A creature who fails this save by 5 or more also falls {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Throw
entries: Kishina attempts to throw a Large or smaller enemy she can see within 5 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be moved up to 15 feet away from her and be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Shield (3/Day; 1st-Level Spell)
entries: When Kishina is targeted by an attack or a {@spell magic missile} spell, she conjures an {@condition invisible} barrier of force. Until the start of her next turn, she gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and takes no damage from magic missile.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Radlee makes an attack, she has advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: Radlee has advantage on saving throws against being moved against her will or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Tactical Vigilance
entries: Radlee has advantage on initiative checks.
While she isn't {@condition incapacitated}, Radlee and each ally within 30 feet of her who can see or hear her can't be surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Radlee makes three Halberd or three Longbow attacks. Alternatively, she makes one Halberd attack and uses Backswipe.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Backswipe
entries: Radlee swings her halberd's shaft at a creature within 5 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Protector
entries: When a creature Radlee can see within 10 feet of her attacks one of her allies, Radlee can make a Halberd attack against the attacker.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During his first turn, Scarlet has advantage on attack rolls against any creature who hasn't taken a turn.
The first hit Scarlet scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Scarlet deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Scarlet who isn't incapacitated and Scarlet doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Scarlet makes three Shadow Blade or three Shortbow attacks.

action.name: Shadow Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) necrotic damage. If a target is hit by two or more Shadow Blade attacks on a turn, they must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Razor Garrote
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, they take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) slashing damage at the start of each of their turns, and Scarlet can't attack another target.

action.name: Umbral Breath {@recharge}
entries: Scarlet exhales dark flame in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition frightened} of Scarlet for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition frightened}.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Scarlet takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Aronar can cast the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Charm Resistant
entries: Aronar has advantage on saving throws he makes to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on himself.

trait.name: Delusions of Grandeur
entries: Whenever Aronar is affected by an effect (such as the {@spell hold person} spell) that allows him to make a saving throw at the end of his turn, he can also repeat that saving throw at the start of his turn. Additionally, whenever Aronar succeeds on a saving throw against an effect, he ends that effect on himself and any ally within 30 feet of him under the same effect.

trait.name: Sun Eater's Grace (3/Day)
entries: When Aronar is within 30 feet of Athmia and casts a spell that restores hit points to another creature, Athmia regains the same number of hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Aronar makes three Divine Mace attacks, or he makes one Divine Mace attack and one God Complex attack.

action.name: Divine Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: God Complex (3/Day; 3rd-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of Aronar's next turn has advantage.

action.name: Cure Wounds (3/Day; 3rd-Level Spell)
entries: Aronar touches a creature and the target regains 21 ({@dice 3d8 + 8}) hit points.

bonus.name: Vainglory (3/Day; 3rd-Level Spell)
entries: A creature of Aronar's choice within 60 feet of him regains 15 ({@dice 3d4 + 8}) hit points.

reaction.name: Sun Eater's Soul (3/Day)
entries: When a creature Aronar can see within 30 feet of him is hit with an attack, he can halve the attack's damage dealt to them.

trait.name: Charm Resistant
entries: Athmia has advantage on saving throws she makes to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on herself.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Athmia is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Mental Assault (1/Turn)
entries: When Athmia hits a creature with her Soul Blade attack, she can assault their mind. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw or expend one spell slot of the highest level available with no effect. A creature who fails this saving throw but can't expend a spell slot must instead spend 3 of their Hit Dice with no effect, or if they can't, take an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Athmia makes two Soul Blade attacks.

action.name: Soul Blade
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 5d6 + 8}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Athmia until the end of her next turn.

action.name: Psychic Frenzy (1/Day)
entries: Athmia clouds the minds of her foes.

Each enemy within 60 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the start of her next turn. Athmia gains 5 temporary hit points for each creature who fails this save.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Athmia takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

bonus.name: Sun Eater's Gift (3/Day)
entries: While within 30 feet of Aronar, Athmia swaps places with him if he is willing.

reaction.name: Sun Eater's Mind (3/Day)
entries: When a creature Athmia can see within 60 feet of her makes a spell attack against her or casts a spell that requires her to make a saving throw, she can pierce their mind, and the next attack she makes against that creature is automatically a critical hit.

trait.name: Forest Defense
entries: When Caithas is in forest terrain and is targeted by a ranged attack by an attacker he can see, the attack has disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Caithas makes three Scimitar or three Scaled Longbow attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Scaled Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature who hasn't attacked Caithas since the end of his last turn, he has advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Manifestation {@recharge 5}
entries: Caithas calls on his connection with Qazyldrath, and the dragon manifests in Caithas's space and exhales dark energy in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, that area is filled with magical darkness for 1 minute. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and supernatural light can't illuminate it. The manifestation of Qazyldrath then disappears.

bonus.name: Gaze of the Decay (1/Day)
entries: Caithas chooses a creature he can see within 60 feet of him, magically marking them for 24 hours. While Caithas and the marked creature are on the same plane of existence, he always knows the distance and direction to them. Additionally, a marked creature can't hide from him, and if the marked creature becomes {@condition invisible}, they gain no benefit from that condition against Caithas.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Draven can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Draven makes an attack, he has advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Profane Sacrifice (1/Turn)
entries: When Draven hits a creature with a melee attack, he can sacrifice his vitality to empower the attack. The target's speed drops to 0 until the start of his next turn, and Draven takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Draven makes three Gloom Dagger attacks.

action.name: Gloom Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d4 + 8}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) necrotic damage, and Draven can move the target up to 10 feet horizontally. If the damage from this attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, Draven regains a use of Blood of the Dragon.

action.name: Blood of the Dragon (1/Day)
entries: Draven boils the blood of up to three creatures he can see within 60 feet of him. Each target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn) and knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Creeping Dread
entries: Draven chooses a creature he can see within 30 feet of him in an area of dim light or darkness. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or move their speed in a direction chosen by Draven. A creature with advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} has advantage on this saving throw, and a creature who can't be {@condition frightened} automatically succeeds on it.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Vivienn makes an attack, she has advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of her turn, Vivienn can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls made during her turn, but attack rolls made against her have advantage until the start of her next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Vivienn makes three Godslayer Axe attacks.

action.name: Godslayer Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d12 + 8}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is a Celestial, they take an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Draconic Rage (3/Day)
entries: Vivienn roars with the might of dragons, entering a rage that lasts for 1 minute or until she is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, she gains the following benefits:

items: Her size becomes Large.
She has a +2 bonus to weapon damage rolls.
She has advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws.
She has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

bonus.name: Ravenous Bite (Draconic Rage Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d12 + 8}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Vivienn for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

condition.name: Dazed
entries: A {@b dazed} creature can only do one of the following things on their turn: move, use an action, or use a bonus action. If a creature becomes dazed during their turn, their turn ends. The {@i cure ailment} power, {@spell lesser restoration} spell, and {@spell greater restoration} spell remove the dazed condition. At the GM's discretion, other powers, spells, or effects might also remove the dazed condition.

When a dazed creature is affected by a spell or effect that gives them an extra action on their turn (like the {@spell haste} spell or the fighter's Action Surge feature), they can still take this extra action, in addition to the movement, action, or bonus action allowed by the dazed condition.

Some creatures in this book have immunity to the dazed condition. At the GM's discretion, a creature published in the core rules or another supplement who has immunity to the paralyzed or stunned condition also has immunity to the dazed condition.

condition.name: Flanked
entries: If your game uses the optional flanking rules in the core rules, a creature who is immune to the {@b flanked} condition can't be flanked regardless of the position of their enemies.

sense.name: Soulsight
entries: Demons have a special sense called soulsight, allowing them to perceive each creature, other than Constructs and Undead, within a certain radius. Soulsight doesn't rely on sight but counts as "seeing" for features that require sight. Neither physical objects (including total cover) nor supernatural effects can impede soulsight unless otherwise stated. A demon's stat block lists the radius of their soulsight under "Senses."

optionalfeature.name: Control Projectiles
entries: {@i 2nd-Order Telekinesis Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 reaction, which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes a ranged weapon attack
{@b Range:} 60 feet
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous
You telekinetically affect the projectile's flight. The attack roll is made with advantage or disadvantage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Deserved Transfer
entries: {@i 2nd-Order Metamorphosis Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous

You fire a bolt of draining psychic energy at a creature within range. Make a ranged power attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} psychic damage, and the psychic energy bounces to another creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The second creature gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.
{@b Increased Order.} When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 or more. For each increase of 1, the damage increases by {@damage 2d8}.

optionalfeature.name: Dream Spores
entries: {@i 5th-Order Telepathy Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} Concentration, up to 1 minute

You release a burst of psionic spores. Each creature you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. While charmed in this way, a creature must use their movement during their turn to move within 10 feet of you by the safest available route.
A creature charmed in this way can repeat the saving throw whenever they take damage, ending the effect on themself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Eyes
entries: {@i 3rd-Order Resopathy Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 120 feet
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous

You beam elemental energy from your eyes at a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d10} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Choose the damage type from the following list: cold, fire, lightning, or radiant.
{@b Increased Order.} When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 or more. For each increase of 1, the damage increases by {@damage 2d10}.

optionalfeature.name: Invigorated March
entries: {@i 3rd-Order Metamorphosis Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 bonus action
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous

You emit a burst of mentally invigorating energy into the mind of a creature you can see within range. That creature can use their reaction, if available, to move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
{@b Increased Order.} When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 or more. For each increase of 1, you target one additional creature.

optionalfeature.name: Liquefy
entries: {@i 3rd-Order Metamorphosis Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 reaction
{@b Range:} 5 feet
{@b Duration:} 1 round

You psionically barrage your attacker with transformative energy. The attacker must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away from you and restrained until the end of their next turn, as their lower body temporarily melts into an immovable goo.

optionalfeature.name: Memory Thief
entries: {@i 4th-Order Metamorphosis Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} Concentration, up to 1 minute

You plunder the mind of a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage, their proficiency bonus is lowered by 1, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and your power save DC for the duration.
{@b Increased Order.} When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 or more. For each increase of 1, the damage increases by {@damage 2d10}.

optionalfeature.name: Mental Lance
entries: {@i 3rd-Order Telepathy Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 60 feet
{@b Duration:} Concentration, up to 1 minute

You mentally assail a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} of you for the duration (save ends at end of turn). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't frightened.
{@b Increased Order.} When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 or more. For each increase of 1, the damage increases by {@damage 2d10}.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Scream
entries: {@i 3rd-Order Telepathy Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous

You psionically pierce the mind of each enemy you can see within range. Each target must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is automatically stabilized.
{@b Increased Order.} When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 or more. For each increase of 1, the damage increases by {@damage 2d6}.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Splinter
entries: {@i 1st-Order Telepathy Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 60 feet
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous

You attempt to erase your image from the mind of a creature within range. Make a ranged power attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage, and you become {@condition invisible} to them until the start of your next turn.
This power's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Phase
entries: {@i 4th-Order Metamorphosis Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} Self
{@b Duration:} Concentration, up to 1 minute

You imbue your body and everything you wear and carry with psychic energy, allowing it to pass through solid objects. For the duration, you can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take {@damage 1d10} force damage if you end your turn inside an object. If this power ends while you are inside a creature or object, you are shunted out of it into the closest unoccupied space of your choice.
{@b Increased Order.} When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 or more. For each increase of 1, you target one additional creature within 5 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Piscine Transformation
entries: {@i 3rd-Order Metamorphosis Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} Concentration, up to 10 minutes

You target a Humanoid you can see within range with a pulse of transformational energy. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or undergo one of the following transformations of your choice for the duration. The target can choose to fail this saving throw.

items: {@b Head.} The target's head transforms into the head of a fish, proportionately sized for their body. They can't speak.
{@b Legs.} The target's legs become fins. Their walking speed is reduced to 10 feet (unless their walking speed is slower), and they gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.

{@b Torso.} The target's torso becomes the body of a fish with gills. They can only breathe water and can hold their breath for 1 hour. If the target isn't underwater when this transformation takes effect, they begin suffocating.

entries: {@b Increased Order.} When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 2 to target any creature, instead of just a Humanoid, if they have the necessary body part you wish to transform.
Additionally, you can increase this power's order by 2 to increase its duration to 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Shockwave
entries: {@i 2nd-Order Telekinesis Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 bonus action
{@b Range:} Self
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous
You unleash a psionic shock wave. Each creature within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet directly away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Sickening Sympathy
entries: {@i 2nd-Order Telekinesis Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 reaction, which you take when another creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit with an attack
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} 1 round
The creature who made the triggering attack must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@damage poisoned} until the end of their next turn as they feel the nauseous pain of their target.

optionalfeature.name: Vanish for One
entries: {@i 2nd-Order Resopathy Power}
{@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 60 feet
{@b Duration:} Concentration, up to 1 minute

You obscure yourself in the sight of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or you become {@damage invisible} to them for the duration (save ends at end of turn). This effect ends early if you attack the creature, deal damage to them, or create an effect that forces them to make a saving throw.
{@b Increased Order.} When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 to make its manifestation time 1 bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Adept Climber
entries: The bear has a climbing speed of 25 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Arctic Traveler
entries: The bear has advantage on saving throws to avoid gaining exhaustion, can tolerate temperatures as cold as −50° Fahrenheit, and ignores difficult terrain created by ice or snow.

optionalfeature.name: Bonus Action: Fearsome Growl (1/Day)
entries: The bear lets out a mighty growl. Each creature within 15 feet of the bear who can hear them must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the bear until the end of the bear's next turn. A creature who succeeds on their saving throw is immune to the Fearsome Growl of all bears for 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Clever Claws
entries: The bear can use their long claws in place of thieves' tools to open locks, and they gain a +3 bonus to Dexterity checks made to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Jaws
entries: The bear's Bite attack deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage, and it deals maximum damage to Plants. (A bear with this feature can't take the Multiattack action.)

optionalfeature.name: Sprint (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

prerequisite.other: Black bear, brown bear (grizzly bear), polar bear, spectacled bear, or sun bear

entries: When the bear moves on their turn in combat, they can triple their speed until the end of their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Action: Crushing Grip
entries: The bird's powerful talons crush a creature they are grappling or attached to. The target must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Aerial Pursuit (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the bird starts their turn in the air, they can triple their flying speed until the end of their turn. If they descend at least 30 feet on that turn, they have advantage on the next attack they make before the end of their turn. (Replaces the High-Speed Dive trait.)

optionalfeature.name: Agile Flyer
entries: While in the air, the bird has a +5 bonus to Dexterity saving throws and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Decapitating Strike
entries: When the bird scores a critical hit against a Tiny target, the target is decapitated. A decapitated target dies if they can't survive without that head.

optionalfeature.name: Glide
entries: The bird can take a short rest while flying horizontally.

optionalfeature.name: Night Hunter
entries: The bird has darkvision out to a range of 120 feet and has a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Ocean Hunter
entries: When the bird starts their turn above water, they don't have disadvantage on attacks due to being underwater until the end of their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Impact
entries: If the bird descends at least 20 feet on their turn immediately before hitting with a Rending Talons attack or Talons attack, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. (+1 CR)

optionalfeature.name: Scavenger's Resilience
entries: The bird has advantage on Constitution saving throws and resistance to poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Hover
entries: The bird can hover while flying.

optionalfeature.name: Action: Deafening Song (Recharge 6)
entries: The swarm produces an earsplitting buzz. Each creature within 15 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be deafened (save ends at end of turn).

optionalfeature.name: Action: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes two Bite attacks. (+1 CR)

optionalfeature.name: Burrower
entries: The swarm has a burrowing speed of 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision

prerequisite.other: Beetles, mosquitoes, cockroaches, or any nocturnal insect

entries: The swarm has darkvision out to a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Disease Carrier
entries: When the swarm hits a creature with an attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} (save ends at end of turn).

optionalfeature.name: Durable
entries: The swarm's hit points are doubled, and they have an Armor Class of 15, a +5 bonus to Constitution saving throws, and advantage on Constitution saving throws. (+1 CR)

optionalfeature.name: Flyer

prerequisite.other: Cicadas, locusts, wasps, or any flying insect

entries: The swarm has a flying speed of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Sting

prerequisite.other: Fire ants, bullet ants, or wasps

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, or 1 piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage if the swarm has half their hit points or fewer. (Replaces the Bite attack)

optionalfeature.name: Adept Climber

prerequisite.other: Clouded leopard, jaguar, leopard, lynx, or snow leopard

entries: The wildcat has a climbing speed of 25 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Agile Landing
entries: The wildcat takes no damage from falling 40 feet or less, provided they aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Bite
entries: When the wildcat hits a {@condition prone} creature with a Bite attack, the attack is a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Desert Dweller
entries: The wildcat ignores difficult terrain created by dirt and sand. They can tolerate temperatures as high as 120° Fahrenheit, and they don't need to drink water as long as they have fresh food.

optionalfeature.name: Mountain Dweller
entries: The wildcat ignores difficult terrain created by snow, ice, or steep slopes.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Sprint (2/Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the wildcat moves on their turn in combat, they can quadruple their speed until the end of their turn. (Replaces the Sprint trait.)

optionalfeature.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wildcat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wildcat's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@creature incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Leap

prerequisite.other: Caracal, cougar, lion, margay, serval, or snow leopard

entries: The wildcat has a climbing speed of 25 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Swimmer
entries: The wildcat has a swimming speed of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Noxious Vines
entries: {@recharge 5} Long toxic vines whip out from the hag. Each enemy within 30 feet of the hag must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each ally within 30 feet of the hag regains 18 ({@damage 4d8}) hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Phantoms Abound
entries: {@recharge 5} The hag fills the area around them with illusions of their enemies' worst fears. Each enemy within 30 feet of the hag must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage, falls {@condition prone}, and if the hag is within 5 feet of the target, the hag can make a Dream Claw attack against them. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage, doesn't fall {@condition prone}, and the hag doesn't attack them.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Detritus
entries: {@recharge 5} The hag conjures magical seaweed and fish guts to restrain their foes. Each enemy in a 30-foot cone emanating from the hag must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained} until the end of the hag's next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

optionalfeature.name: Hear the Unseen
entries: At the start of their turn, the cave creature can emit a subsonic trill (no action required). If they aren't {@condition deafened}, they can see their surroundings, including {@condition invisible} and hidden creatures within 200 feet of them who aren't behind total cover, until the end of their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Rockbreaker
entries: Chitinous claws or blades around the cave creature's limbs give them a burrowing speed of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Tunnel-Adapted
entries: Without squeezing, the cave creature can move through spaces large enough for a creature one size smaller than them.

optionalfeature.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The enchanted forest creature can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

optionalfeature.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once per turn, the enchanted forest creature can use 10 feet of their movement to step magically into one living tree within reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be the same size category as the enchanted forest creature or bigger.

optionalfeature.name: Living Forest
entries: A writhing grove thrives in a 30-foot radius centered on the enchanted forest creature. Mist lightly obscures that area, and colorful vines and shifting foliage make its ground difficult terrain. Teasing voices laugh and whisper, giving other creatures in that area disadvantage on saving throws made to maintain concentration on spells and similar effects. Flickering lights extinguish magical darkness in that area created by spells of 3rd level or lower. (When adding this trait to a creature, you can choose to exclude one or more of these effects.)

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Decay
entries: The tomb creature has resistance to necrotic damage, and immunity to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Touch of Rot
entries: When the tomb creature hits a target with a melee attack, the attack deals {@damage PB} extra necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Undying Hunger
entries: The tomb creature can perceive each creature within 30 feet of them who isn't a Construct or an Undead, as if the tomb creature had {@sense blindsight}.

optionalfeature.name: Ruin Climber
entries: The ruined keep creature has a climbing speed equal to their walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Ruin Delver
entries: When the ruined keep creature is behind an object that grants them half cover, they are considered to have three-quarters cover instead.

optionalfeature.name: Ruin Runner
entries: The ruined keep creature ignores difficult terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Low-Light Senses
entries: The sewer creature gains {@sense blindsight} or {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Used to Filth
entries: The sewer creature gains resistance to poison damage and immunity to the {@condition poisoned} condition. If the creature already has resistance to poison damage, they gain immunity to poison damage instead.

optionalfeature.name: Of Unusual Size
entries: If the sewer creature is Small or Tiny, their size increases to Medium and their Hit Dice type changes to a d8. This gives them 1 extra hit point per Hit Die if originally Small, or 2 extra hit points per Hit Die if originally Tiny.

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Nature
entries: The natural acidity of the swamp gives the swamp creature resistance to acid damage. If the creature already has resistance to acid damage, they gain immunity to acid damage instead.

optionalfeature.name: Swamp Stride
entries: The swamp creature ignores difficult terrain caused by the natural conditions of a swamp.

optionalfeature.name: One with the Swamp
entries: The swamp creature has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive creatures within a swamp who don't have this trait.

optionalfeature.name: Fungal Infestation
entries: The underground creature is covered in layers of poisonous fungi. They have immunity to poison damage. The first time the underground creature takes damage on a turn, each creature within 5 feet of them takes {@damage PB} poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Blend
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the underground creature can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Underground Senses
entries: The underground creature gains one of the following senses: {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 300 feet, {@sense tremorsense|MM} out to a range of 120 feet, or {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 60 feet.

item.name: Mantle of the Lightbender
entries: This elegant cloak is lined with the iridescent mane of a {@creature lightbender|FleeMortals}. When you're hit with an attack while wearing this cloak, you can use your reaction to reveal that the attacker is attacking a past visual imprint of you. You appear in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of your imprint, the attack misses, then the imprint disappears. You can't use this reaction if the attacker relies on senses other than sight, such as {@sense blindsight}, or if they can perceive illusions as false, as with {@sense truesight}. Once you use the cloak to reveal a past visual imprint of yourself, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Treant Arrow
entries: This arrow is carved from the boughs of a living {@creature treant|FleeMortals}.

When a creature takes damage from the arrow, they are {@condition restrained} by vines that sprout from the shaft. A creature can make a {@dc 15} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check as an action, freeing themself or another creature {@condition restrained} by the arrow within their reach on a success.
Once a treant arrow restrains a creature or if the treant used to make the arrow dies, it becomes a mundane arrow.

item.name: Pendant of Grave Regeneration
entries: While you wear this pendant, your skin becomes pale and cold to the touch, and you regain 5 hit points at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Attuning to this pendant extends its curse to you. Until the curse is broken with a remove curse spell or similar magic, you can't take it off, and your creature type is Undead instead of your normal type.

item.name: Tome of the Ethereal
entries: Lighter than it rightly should be, this book is always cold to the touch and blurs when seen in periphery. While holding the tome, you can see into the Ethereal Plane out to a range of 120 feet.

In addition, the tome has 3 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dusk. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you targets you with a power, a spell, or an attack while you aren't on the Ethereal Plane, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge and choose one of the following effects:

items: You enter the Ethereal Plane, then return to the plane and the space you left at the start of your next turn.

entries: If that space is occupied, you return to the nearest unoccupied space of your choice.

items: You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

item.name: Boog's Ball
entries: This magic stone sphere is incredibly dense, has a 3-inch radius, and grows when thrown. As an action, you can throw the ball at a point you can see within 60 feet of you. If you throw the ball 30 feet or less away from you, the ball grows to a 5-foot radius. If you throw the ball farther than 30 feet, it grows to a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the ball's area when it reaches that point must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage. The ball then shrinks back to its 3-inch radius and teleports either into your open hand or into a pack or pouch you wear (your choice).

item.name: Poison Popper
entries: You can throw this inedible fruit at a point you can see within 60 feet of you, causing it to explode and release a cloud of noxious gas in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. The cloud spreads around corners and lingers for 1 minute. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

The cloud's area is {@quickref Vision and Light||2||lightly obscured}, and when a creature enters it for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there, they must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature's speed is halved. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

item.name: Iron Ring
entries: While wearing this ring, you can use an action to speak a passphrase known only to the High Command of the Black Iron Pact—"Blood of Rioja"—and choose a target destination. If you are not in the demiplane known as the Cyst, you must choose a destination within the Cyst. If you are already in the Cyst, you must choose a destination you have visited before. Once you choose a destination in this way, the ring teleports you there. The ring can be used to teleport twice and regains both uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Once you attune to this ring, you can't take it off or end your attunement to it unless you are targeted by a {@i cure ailment} power of 4th order or higher or the {@spell greater restoration} spell.

entries.name: (Requires Attunement)
entries: This magic maul is made of a durable, light metal and has a long haft, giving it a reach of 10 feet. When you hit a creature with this maul, they are hexed until the end of their next turn. Whenever a creature hexed in this way makes an attack roll or saving throw, they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.
While you hold the maul, you can use an action to change the appearance of its head, choosing its shape and color.

item.name: Eye of Sunrise
entries: A crimson gemstone glitters on the back of this black iron gauntlet. While wearing the gauntlet, you can use a bonus action to cause the stone to shed bright red light in a 10-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} for an additional 10 feet. You can use another bonus action to extinguish the light.

Additionally, you can use an action to raise the gauntlet and emit a fiery explosion in a 30-foot cone. The explosion can be heard 300 feet away. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} fire damage plus {@damage 5d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each structure and mundane object in the area that isn't being worn or carried takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage plus {@damage 10d6} force damage. Once this action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Waning Moon
entries: This slender elven bow is lacquered blue and purple.
Its inside curve twinkles with tiny diamonds set like a field of stars.
This magical longbow grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. If you hit a creature who can't see you with this bow, the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage.
Additionally, when you hit a target with an attack made with the bow, you can choose to become {@condition invisible} for 1 minute and take the {@action Hide} action as part of the attack.
The invisibility ends early if you attack, cast a spell, or manifest a power. Once this invisibility has been used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Amethyst Die
entries: This gaming die is carved from a fragment of powerful psionic crystal and resonates with a remnant of its power. This die has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can expend 1 charge to roll a {@dice d6} and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20} roll. Immediately after the ability check, attack roll, or saving throw is resolved, you take psychic damage equal to twice the number you rolled on the {@dice d6}.

item.name: Mindrazor
entries: This rapier was forged using shattered fragments of a powerful psionic crystal and ore from a falling star. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This rapier has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack roll using this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to attempt to inflict a psionic wound. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw or become vulnerable to psychic damage for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

item.name: Bracers of the Spellbreaker
entries: These mithral bracers are engraved with runes and inlaid with three multicolored bands of tiny gemstones.
While wearing these bracers, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. In addition, damage from your spell attacks ignore your target's damage resistances.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The bracers are a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

item.name: Crown of Majesty
entries: This mithral circlet is inscribed with an intricate filigree formed of Elvish runes. The front of the circlet holds a flawless diamond that changes hue in sunlight.
While wearing this crown, you have resistance to psychic damage, and you can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

The crown has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action and expend 1 charge to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 18): {@spell command} or {@spell charm person}. The crown regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The crown is a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

item.name: Pathfinder's Boots
entries: Silver eyelets decorate these soft leather boots. While wearing these boots, you gain a +2 bonus to your AC and your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

The boots have 7 charges. While wearing them, you can expend 1 charge to cast one of the following spells from them: {@spell feather fall}, {@spell jump}, or {@spell shield}. The boots regain {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The boots are a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

item.name: Ring of Scarlet Shadows
entries: This iridium ring is inlaid with an obsidian band. The stone inlay occasionally appears to writhe or shift, as if shadows play along its surface.

While wearing this ring, you gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet, or if you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Shadow Blade
entries: You can use a bonus action to extend a blade of shadows from the hand that wears the ring. You can wield the blade as a shortsword that deals necrotic damage instead of piercing damage. While the blade is extended, you can't drop it or hold anything else in that hand. You can dismiss the blade as a bonus action.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The ring is a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

item.name: Visionary's Cloak
entries: This gray, hooded traveler's cloak sports a white silk hem and a platinum clasp that, when closed, resembles the shape of an eye.
While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on initiative checks and can't be surprised.

Additionally, when you wear the cloak with the hood up, you gain {@sense truesight} out to a range of 60 feet and your eyes cast a soft blue-white glow. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The cloak is a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

item.name: Sun Eater's Mind
entries: The shifting shadows within this black glass ring constantly move. While wearing this ring, when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes a spell attack against you or casts a spell that requires you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to pierce the creature's mind. The next attack you make against that creature before the end of your next turn is automatically a critical hit. The ring can be used to pierce a creature's mind three times and regains all uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Sun Eater's Gift
entries: While within 30 feet of a willing creature who is attuned to the Sun Eater's soul, you can use a bonus action to swap places with them. The ring can be used to swap places three times and regains all uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Sun Eater's Soul
entries: This black metal ring is unnervingly matte, reflecting nothing even in the brightest of light. While wearing this ring, when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the damage that creature takes from the attack. The ring can be used to halve damage three times and regains all uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Sun Eater's Grace
entries: When you cast a spell that restores hit points to a creature, you can also restore that same number of hit points to a creature within 30 feet of you who is attuned to the Sun Eater's mind. The ring can be used to restore hit points three times and regains all uses daily at dusk.

legendaryGroup.name: Medusa
lairActions: When fighting inside their lair, a medusa can take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the medusa can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects; the medusa can't use the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Venom Shower
entries: Black venom rains down in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point the medusa can see within 90 feet of them. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Shadowstep
entries: The medusa teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

items.name: Venom Shower
entries: The statues in the medusa's lair scream in pain. Each enemy within 60 feet of the medusa who can hear them must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the medusa until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

legendaryGroup.name: Overmind
lairActions: When fighting inside their lair, an overmind can take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the overmind can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects; the overmind can't use the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Gas Belch
entries: A hole opens in the ceiling, floor, or wall at a point the overmind chooses within 60 feet of them and belches a 20-foot-sphere of smelly gas that lasts until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round. When a creature enters that area for the first time or starts their turn there, they must succeed on a {@dc  15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of their next turn.

items.name: Slime Shower
entries: Viscous slime falls from the ceiling toward one enemy within 120 feet of the overmind. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be vulnerable to fire and lightning damage. The effect ends when they take fire or lightning damage, or at the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Telekinetic Hold
entries: An invisible force attempts to grab three enemies within 60 feet of the overmind. Each creature must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature's speed becomes 0 and they rise vertically 20 feet in the air, suspended there until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round, at which point they fall.

legendaryGroup.name: Lich
lairActions: When fighting inside their lair, a lich can take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the lich can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects; the lich can't use the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Soul Sip
entries: The lich chooses two enemies they can see within 90 feet of them. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 19 ({@damage 3d12}) necrotic damage as the lair absorbs a sliver of their soul.

items.name: Spirit Shell
entries: The lich summons spirits to surround them until the end of initiative count 20 of the next round. For the duration, a creature who hits the lich with a melee attack must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the start of the creature's next turn.

items.name: Unnatural Born Leader
entries: The lich magnifies the power of their soulstone through the lair onto a creature they can see within 90 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or use their reaction, if available, to move up to their speed and make a weapon attack against a creature of the lich's choice.

legendaryGroup.name: Vampire
lairActions: When fighting inside their lair, a vampire can take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the vampire can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects; the vampire can't use the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Children of the Night
entries: A swarm of bats and insects flies around the vampire, moving with them. The area within 30 feet of the vampire is heavily obscured for other creatures until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Blood Rain
entries: The vampire chooses a point they can see within 60 feet of them. Blood rains down in a 40-foothigh, 10-foot-radius cylinder centered on this point until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round. When a creature who isn't Undead in the cylinder takes necrotic damage, they take an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage.

items.name: Obey My Desire
entries: The vampire exerts their will on those who surround them. Each creature within 60 feet of the vampire who can hear them must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the vampire until the end of this turn. Each charmed creature must immediately use their reaction, if available, to make a melee attack against another creature, to make a melee attack against themself, or to drop {@condition prone} (vampire's choice).

legendaryGroup.name: Cave
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the cave creature can take one of the following lair actions; the cave creature can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Rocky Bulwark
entries: The cave creature magically attracts nearby stones, forming a stone armor that grants a +PB bonus to AC but reduces their speed by 10 feet. The creature loses the armor at the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Strategic Blockage
entries: The cave creature causes loose rocks to fall, creating a 15-foot cube of solid earth centered on a point within 60 feet of them. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 plus PB Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage PBd6} bludgeoning damage and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space of the cave creature's choice outside that area. On a successful save, a creature takes no damage and is moved into the nearest unoccupied space of their choice outside that area. A creature within reach of the cube can use an action to remove a section of the cube as large as the space the creature occupies.

items.name: Tremor
entries: The cave creature causes an earthquake centered on a point they can see within 60 feet of them. Each other creature on the ground within 30 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 12 plus PB Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

legendaryGroup.name: Enchanted Forest
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the enchanted forest creature can take one of the following lair actions; the enchanted forest creature can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Frothing Flora
entries: The enchanted forest creature causes roots and vines to temporarily grow around them; until initiative count 20 on the next round, the ground within 30 feet of the enchanted forest creature is difficult terrain.

items.name: Writhing Roots
entries: Foliage in the enchanted forest creature's lair becomes a conduit for the enchanted forest creature's power. The enchanted forest creature can target creatures of their choice that are touching such plant life within 90 feet of the enchanted forest creature. A target must succeed on a DC 12 plus PB Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage PBd6} psychic damage and be {@condition grappled} (escape DC 12 plus PB).

items.name: Faerie Lights
entries: The enchanted forest creature creates dancing lights in a 20-foot cube at a point they can see within 120 feet of them. Each creature in that area who can see the lights must make a DC 12 plus PB Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition blinded}, outlined in light, and sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round. Attack rolls against an affected creature have advantage if the attacker can see them, and the affected creature can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.

legendaryGroup.name: Tomb
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the tomb creature can take one of the following lair actions; the tomb creature can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Chorus of Torment
entries: The tomb creature commands the souls of the dead to wail. Each creature within 120 feet of the tomb creature must succeed on a DC 12 plus PB Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the tomb creature until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Desecrated Ground
entries: The tomb creature draws in ambient necrotic power and gains 2 × PB temporary hit points. These temporary hit points last until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Grave Grasp
entries: The corpses and souls of the restless dead attempt to drag the living into their graves. All ground within 60 feet of the tomb creature becomes difficult terrain until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round. Undead creatures ignore this difficult terrain.

legendaryGroup.name: Ruined Keep
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the ruined keep creature can take one of the following lair actions; the ruined keep creature can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Crumbling Rubble
entries: Pieces of the structure crumble into three 5-foot cubes within 30 feet of the ruined keep creature. Creatures in those areas must succeed on a DC 12 plus PB Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage PBd6} bludgeoning damage. Those areas become difficult terrain.

items.name: Express Descent
entries: The ruined keep creature collapses a 5-foot-square section of floor within 30 feet of them, opening a hole to the floor below. A Medium or smaller creature in that area must succeed on a DC 12 plus PB Dexterity saving throw or fall through the floor.

items.name: Swaying Structure
entries: Old timber and decrepit stone sways, shifts, and lurches. Each other creature within 60 feet of the ruined keep creature must succeed on a DC 12 plus PB Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. Flying creatures automatically succeed on this saving throw.

legendaryGroup.name: Sewer
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the sewer creature can take one of the following lair actions; the sewer creature can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Cave-In
entries: The sewer creature rakes debris from the ceiling or knocks loose an ancient column, and the sewer tunnel partially collapses in a 15-foot cube centered on a point the sewer creature can see within 60 feet of them. Creatures in that area must succeed on a DC 10 plus PB Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage PBd6} bludgeoning damage from the falling rubble. Additionally, soot and debris heavily obscure that area for the next round, and it becomes difficult terrain.

items.name: Covered in Muck
entries: The sewer creature crushes a fungal growth near them, releasing a cloud of toxic spores. Each creature within 30 feet of the sewer creature must succeed on a DC 10 plus PB Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Open Valves
entries: The sewer creature cranks a valve or breaks a pipe, causing sewage to gush from a point within 60 feet of the sewer creature. Each creature in a 10-footwide, 60-foot-long line originating from that point must succeed on a DC 10 plus PB Strength saving throw or fall prone in the sewage and be pushed 15 feet away from the point where the sewage originated.

legendaryGroup.name: Swamp
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the swamp creature can take one of the following lair actions; the swamp creature can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The swamp creature can move up to half their speed and then make a Dexterity (Stealth) check to hide, even if they are being observed by other creatures.

items.name: Swamp Gas
entries: The swamp creature chooses a point on the ground that they can see within 120 feet of them, causing a pocket of acidic swamp gas to erupt from it. Each creature, other than the swamp creature, in a 20-foot cube centered on that point must succeed on a DC 12 plus PB Constitution saving throw or take {@damage PBd6} acid damage.

items.name: Swamp Medicine
entries: The swamp creature draws on the life energy of the swamp and regains {@damage PBd6} hit points.

legendaryGroup.name: Underground
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the underground creature can take one of the following lair actions; the underground creature can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Cloud of Darkness
entries: The underground creature creates a 20-foot-radius area of magical darkness centered on a point they can see within 60 feet of them. The underground creature can see through the darkness, which lasts until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round unless ended early by the dispel magic spell. Other creatures with {@sense darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and light can't illuminate it unless created by a spell of 3rd level or higher.

items.name: Feasting Call
entries: The underground creature lets out a frenzied cry. Until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round, each ally within 300 feet of the underground creature who can hear them becomes enraged. While enraged, a creature has advantage on melee weapon attack rolls, and attack rolls against them have advantage.

items.name: Treacherous Ground
entries: The underground creature causes a tremor in the ground. Each creature within 30 feet of them must succeed on a DC 12 plus PB Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
